title: Excellent position, if noisy, but Jaipur is a very busy city so don't expect peace and quiet   it is stunning though and so much
text: The hotel itself was fine, but the reception staff were not very friendly, the bar was hidden in the basement. Bin general not welcoming
placeInfo/address: Station Road Near Central Bus Stand, Jaipur 302001 India

title: Old building, Decent clean rooms, Tricky staff
text:
It may be an old fort converted to a hotel. The building has an interesting architecture and some beautiful decorations. Some parts of the building is abandoned or under construction. Hotel is located in a busy bus station area (Sindhi Camp). Nothing touristic there except busy and dirty streets, tiny shops and many vehicles. 

Because of recent bad reviews, before arriving, our travel Coordinator specifically asked for clean and quiet rooms for our group.  And we got clean and quiet rooms in the 3rd floor.  Rooms were nicely decorated and the bed was comfortable. The bathrooms are old and need replacing. No water flow in the shower.

The front desk staff and managers are non responsive and blank. They can’t provide any helpful information or tips to the guests. The bills and payments in the hotel restaurant need to be checked carefully. Overpricing, cash payment irregularities, tricks and mistakes are tried there.  

It’s a basic hotel, with good rooms. Bathrooms need upgrades.
placeInfo/address: Station Road Near Central Bus Stand, Jaipur 302001 India

title: Disaster Stay: Small Rooms, deceptive photos, poor staff
text: I am staying here today and confirm that this hotel is a complete scam. They have put pictures showing bigger area, sofa and what not but in actual the room is even devoid of basic facilities.  The room are dingy, no window to outdoor world (only to inner corridor).
placeInfo/address: Station Road Near Central Bus Stand, Jaipur 302001 India

title: This hotel please avoid.
text:
This hotel is a must avoid. Please avoid going to this hotel. You will get many other hotels at a price much lesser than the price for this hotel. 
Let me explain the pros and cons of this property.

Pros - 
Parking Area is good and safe.
Location is good but given the condition you are travelling to Jaipur by bus.

Cons -
Charging more money for amber suite and giving the room with bare minimum lighting.

Then the reception, reaching out at 2 and the room being not ready. 

The staff works without a smile and with a heavy face as if doing for free.

Then comes the amenities - Two restaurants and not sure on which the food is being ordered and from which the restaurant it is coming.

Food is eremely overpriced. Cost of roti being 55₹ . Dude we are in India we got the wheat in house and we are not importing.

Now the third part and most disgusting one - the travel desk this team is there just to fool people and disturb the guest privacy.

Overall Disgusting Experience !!!
placeInfo/address: Station Road Near Central Bus Stand, Jaipur 302001 India

title: Business trip
text:
The rooms were clean and staff is friendly. It was maintained hygienic. The food was also provided hot and delicious. It was well maintained and they responded immediately when i called for services . 
But the fan isnt working properly so please resolve that issue..
placeInfo/address: Station Road Near Central Bus Stand, Jaipur 302001 India

title: Pathetic staff and liar management
text:
Unsafe environment because of staff, management!
One of the worst hotel management and service I have ever received they denied my confirmation booking and refund amount and requested for jaipur police for help. Details....
I have been to multiple hotels for stay within India and International however I will surely say this hotel failed to meet 1 star rating as well. I had confirmed booking which I did from their own website directly fortchadragupt.com (not from 3rd party hotel bookings like lMakeMyTrip or Goibibo etc...) and when I reached for checkin they clearly said it's not confirmed and denied the global documentation mail format when I showed them confirmation email from their side which includes their both sales and reservation mail IDs. Even staff and management was showing pathetic behaviour and started fight with us in front of my 9 family members including kids. I requested for jaipur police help to get out of the hotel with my refund amount as they denied to refund the amount as well which I paid during booking on their website.
placeInfo/address: Station Road Near Central Bus Stand, Jaipur 302001 India

title: Smerig hotel met oplichters! Absoluut niet boeken

In de linnenkast lag smerig beddengoed en lege waterflessen. De handdoeken én het bed waren vochtig en overal lag een laag stof of troep van zéker enkele maanden oud. Toen ik de was inleverde stond opgeteld op de bon 412 rupie. Toen een van de jongens deze was kwam terugbezorgen moest ik 880 rupie betalen. Na klacht kreeg ik 399 rupie retour.

title: It was average experience at fort chandragupta
text:
My overall experience was amazing but two things i have to admit it in this feedback ,(1) Bedroom was neat and clean but fan was really dirty and i was able to see the dirt on it. And Fridge was really smelly as well.(2) when i called on housekeeping using 61 number for dental kit so lady said “yes sir I am sending it” then it got delayed by 2 minutes so i called again and asked for the same So Staff replied “ abhi abhi to call kiya tha aapne” . So my concern is that if guest call you so many times you have to be polite ,you shouldnt have given this answer.  I was also hotelier and worked in 5 star Properties in jaipur,udaipur. Thats why i am suggesting your staff to be polite. 
These were Issues.

Good part 
Reception staff was really nice they gave me upgraded room so thanks for that. 
Concierge staff very supportive during our transport.

title: Very Good Hotel

placeInfo/address: Station Road Near Central Bus Stand, Jaipur 302001 India

title: Nightmarish Stay: Fort Chandragupt is a breeding ground for dirt and disgust.
text:
My family and I booked two rooms m, hoping for a comfortable base to explore Jaipur. Instead, we were greeted with a scene straight out of a horror movie.
The rooms were absolutely repulsive.  Layers of dust coated every surface some even with cigarette butts, the bed sheets were visibly soiled – it was clear they hadn't been changed, and a musty odor of mold heavy in the air. To our horror, my kids discovered a colony of cockroaches scurrying across the floor and walls. It was utterly disgusting.
Despite our complaints, the staff's response was indifferent and unhelpful. We pressed for a room change but the new rooms offered were equally filthy and infested.  Somehow we stayed in the rooms overnight as we couldn’t find alternative accommodation. The next day my back was hurting due to the worn out and saggy mattress. We were left with no choice but to seek out other accommodations, causing immense stress and wasting precious time during our Jaipur holiday.
This hotel's blatant disregard for hygiene and guest well-being is appalling.  Do yourself a favor and avoid this place at all costs. It's not worth jeopardizing your health and vacation.
placeInfo/address: Station Road Near Central Bus Stand, Jaipur 302001 India

title: Not for everyone!
text:
I would skip this hotel next time. They have no differentiation between smoking and non smoking rooms. We had reserved three rooms , out of which 2 were reeking of cigarette smell. After asking the management to change rooms, they send us a waiter with an air freshener which was equally horrible.
We went to the reception again to ask them firmly to  change our rooms to a non smoking room and they did. That room was pathetic too. They do not provide a hand towel or a bath rug. After requesting the reception to send us a hand towel , the bellboy gave a hand towel which was actually a bath rug. Since we were there for a night only , we did not say anything

The bathroom has a small 1 inch x 1 inch soap that one is supposed to use in showers and handwashing .  The rooms are tiny and they only give one key per room, even if there are more than one person staying in the room. The breakfast buffet was meh.

This place is a place where weddings  are hosted. I don’t know how the management manages to attract possible wedding parties but I would avoid this place .
 The place does have potential to be better as it is a big building. But the way their management runs it , it may not be everyone.
I would give them  1/2 star if I had a choice.
placeInfo/address: Station Road Near Central Bus Stand, Jaipur 302001 India

title: Designed like a fort
text: Centrally located, but next to bus stand, hence a lot of noise from the buses. The property is big and designed like a fort. The restaurant is ok, but the staff is very helpful. Room is clean, but the light switch for the light is all messed up. Bathroom is ok.

title: Prime pick!
text:
Prime Pick !!

Oh! It was just unforgettable stay in Fort Chandragupta hotel. The moment we walked into the hotel, it felt like we had stepped into a palace. The whole place, from the rooms to the reception area and garden, was designed like a palace. The hotel staff provided excellent service throughout our three-day stay. The room's decor and layout were very nice, and the quality of the breakfast and dinner was also good.

If you're planning a trip to Jaipur, whether for family or business, I highly recommend staying at Fort Chandragupt.

Thanks to : 
- Mr. Ashok at the reception made checking in quick and easy, and the two ladies at the front desk made checking out smooth.
- Mr. Dipak and Ms. Arzu provided excellent service. It's impressive that, while still studying, they both offer such top-notch service. There's no need to wish you both good luck because you're hard workers and have a bright future ahead.
placeInfo/address: Station Road Near Central Bus Stand, Jaipur 302001 India

title: Laxmi Heritage Boutique Hotel review
text:
Here is a formalized and structured version of your review:

Review of My One-Night Stay at the Hotel in Jaipur

During my recent visit to Jaipur, I had the opportunity to stay at this hotel for one night with my family. Below is a detailed review based on my experience.

Pros:
Reception Staff: The reception staff was polite and courteous, though their responses were somewhat to the point. They were professional and welcoming.

Housekeeping: The housekeeping staff demonstrated a positive attitude and were also warm and polite. One of the luggage attendants stood out for his humility. When I was unable to tip him on the first day due to a lack of change, he reassured me not to worry about such formalities.

Dining Experience: We had lunch at the hotel, and I found the food to be enjoyable and satisfactory, meeting our expectations.

Terrace Bar: The terrace bar offered a delightful experience, where we enjoyed a small cultural performance featuring folk music and dance. The atmosphere and ambiance were relaxed and pleasing, enhancing our overall enjoyment.

Transport Services: Zakir Bhai, the in-charge of transport services, was cordial and cooperative. The one-day tour he organized covered most of the major attractions in the area.

Cons:
Room Size: The room allocated to us appeared to be smaller than expected. I raised this concern with the manager during checkout, who informed me that larger rooms are available. However, considering the hotel is rated as a 4-star property, I believe that the minimum room size should be larger than the one provided.

Restaurant Service: The restaurant staff did not fully adhere to specific guest requests. Although I did not opt for breakfast, I requested a special tea (for an additional charge) to be prepared with strong elaichi (cardamom) and sugar incorporated during the preparation. Unfortunately, the staff served the tea as part of the standard breakfast offering, with the sugar provided separately in sachets rather than mixed in as per my request.

Breakfast Spread: Although I did not avail myself of the breakfast, I noticed that the spread could be significantly expanded. Given that the hotel claims to be a 4-star establishment, the variety of the breakfast offering should be improved to match that classification.

Conclusion:
If this property were categorized as a 3-star hotel, I would have rated it 4 stars based on my experience. However, as it is classified as a 4-star property, there are areas that require improvement, particularly in terms of room size and the ability to accommodate specific guest requests.

Overall, this hotel could still be a viable option for a stay, especially if priced competitively.
placeInfo/address: D-194, Jagdish Marg, Banipark, Jaipur 302016 India

title: Good, clean base for exploring Jaipur
text:
Had a really good experience at Laxmi Palace hotel. The rooms were spacious and we booked a 3x person room and each of us had a proper bed which was nice as some places just provide sofa beds. 

Beds weren't the comfiest but the room was clean and bathroom was clean and modern. 

Really good service, restaurant food was amazing (except the fish masala which came and looked raw) and the pool area was spotless. 

We would deffo return here and it is in a good location too.

text:
Stay was good. Hotel is clean. Location is also very nice. Restaurant food is good and staff behaviour is very good. Only concern is housekeeping service should be improved bit. Our  bathroom flush was not working properly. Electric jug  was not working initially. In our room few places were having dust. 

Overall I will recommend the hotel.
placeInfo/address: D-194, Jagdish Marg, Banipark, Jaipur 302016 India

title: Pulito ed accogliente
text: In zona tranquilla, ma molto vicino al centro. Ambiente pulito. Personale molto gentile. Cucina buona. Bella la serata al roof top con spettacolo. Piscina piccola ma molto carina, con servizio bar.  Camere ampie, noi avevamo il balcone . Peccato solo un asciugamano a testa, grande, ma per noi europei ne servono 2.
placeInfo/address: D-194, Jagdish Marg, Banipark, Jaipur 302016 India

title: Great service, nice room
text:
The room was large,  clean  and big bathroom.
The service was outstanding.
The Bar could have been better located and more inviting, otherwise a great place to stay. I can not stress how  attentive the staff were especially in helping us with finding a lost article left in an Uber
placeInfo/address: D-194, Jagdish Marg, Banipark, Jaipur 302016 India

title: Good place

Muy recomendable para pasar unos días.
placeInfo/address: D-194, Jagdish Marg, Banipark, Jaipur 302016 India

title: Beware of Money Extortion by the Manager
text:
Beware of Laxmi Palace Heritage Boutique Hotel! Upon check-in, they promised breakfast for both rooms we booked, but after paying, they reneged, claiming it's only for one room. Then, 15 minutes later, the manager demanded extra payment for the third adult, despite earlier assurances that the extra bed was included. The manager's constant changing of terms feels like an attempt to extort money from tourists.

When we refused to pay the extra money which nowhere had mentioned in out booking, the Manager said we should checkout immediately and leave the premises!!

We came from Mauritius and the hotel manager and team tried to rob of with extra charges. The manager was very rude and insulted us. When I told him that I’m reporting this to the Jaipur Police, only then he changed his aggressive behaviour.
Beware, beware, beware!
placeInfo/address: D-194, Jagdish Marg, Banipark, Jaipur 302016 India

title: non ci tornerei
text:
Non tornerei, la struttura sa di vecchio;
in camera forte odore di fogna, capelli in bagno e nel cibo a colazione 
l’acqua della piscina davvero con un brutto aspetto 
disordine nei corridoi
in bagno catini nella doccia 
Nulla di terribile ma non ho apprezzato sensazione di trasandatezza
placeInfo/address: D-194, Jagdish Marg, Banipark, Jaipur 302016 India

title: Un bon hôtel
text:
Nous avons passé deux nuits dans cet hôtel situé à proximité du centre ville et des attractions touristiques. Nous sommes parfaitement satisfaits.
Bon accueil, personnel aimable, très grande chambre bien meublées, salle de bain de bonne taille, belle douche.
Le petit déjeuner est bon et très varié.
placeInfo/address: D-194, Jagdish Marg, Banipark, Jaipur 302016 India

title: Disappointing
text: We had high hopes for the Laxmi but were, sorry hotel team, really disappointed. This isn't a terrible hotel it's just not a great one. The communal areas were great but our room was small and lacking finesse. TV broken, rooms made up after 3pm and some quite surly staff. On a positive note, the food in the restaurant was really good but breakfast was meh and the tea and coffee were, and I don't say this easily, vile. It's also important to note that the hotel is off Station Rd, which is an experience to say the least and not in a good way.
placeInfo/address: D-194, Jagdish Marg, Banipark, Jaipur 302016 India

title: Terrible
text: Service is really poor. We were disturbed at 1 in the midnight. We ordered a fruit platter which was served at12:40. Usually they get bill with food, here they did not get BILL. The person rang bell and disturbed us with bill at one in the night. We had a long day and were tired. And the next day was important as my 13 year old had an important exam.There was also a 7 year old baby . When we asked about time , the person just turned his back and ran , while we were asking his name. We immediately called to main desk and the person there( Shekar) answered our call. We told what had just happened. We told them not to disturb us for the night . Even so a call from dining area came. We were totally disturbed. In the morning while checking out we told the receptionist about this incidents but they did not compensate. They apologised but when we asked for written apology they were not ready to write. According to CONSUMER PROTECTION ACT the consumers should be compensated. We took all three important steps according to law. 1. Immediately complain, 2. Take pictures, 3. Have a reasonable complain. Ans inspire of all this no compensation was given. We stayed in room 425. We payed the total bill and only then checked out. -dr. Vinay and dr. Preethi
placeInfo/address: Plots No. 5 And 6 Airport Plaza, Tonk Road, Durgapura Jai Jawan-2, Choti Chopad, Chandrakala Colony, Durgapura, Jaipur 302018 India

title: Poor as it can be, not a 5 star
text:
At Ramada Jaipur, I took my chance,
Hoping for comfort, a warm welcome glance.
But coldness reigned in every space,
Reception and restaurant—a frosty place.
Three or four stars? They claim the gleam,
But service felt like a forgotten dream.
No warmth, no smiles, just rigid rules,
Turns out the charm was lost in the fools.
White towels marked with yellow stains,
Left doubts of hygiene, lingering remains.
Brajesh at reception—rude and slow,
Turning short waits into marathons, you know.
If poor hospitality’s your craving spree,
This is your stop, as bleak as can be.
But for those who seek kindness and cheer,
Look elsewhere, far from here!
placeInfo/address: Govind Marg Raja Park, Jaipur 302004 India

title: Good room but not so good service
text: I was travelling to Jaipur with a booked tour and this was the only hotel that was a bit disappointing, the staff was not very helpful with my questions as a female solo traveller about safety around the city but I was bothered multiple times via phone calls to my hotel room concerning buffet options and other things I felt like they just wanted to sell. The hotel room itself was nice and all was clean.

title: Left within an hour
text:
Upon arrival we checked in via a not very friendly receptionist, no details about the hotels facilities and not a particularly warm welcome.
Once in our ‘Club Room’ a charming staff member brought up our suitcases.
We went to explore the hotel, the pool area is in need of attention, pigeons were having a dip in the pool.
The gym was not clean. On asking a member of staff to turn on the air on he said it was not his department but then turned it on. The whole rooftop bar / swimming pool area was so unwelcoming.
We returned to our room, and on closer inspection that too was not clean. Toilet needed cleaning, toilet roll had black marks all over it, carpet stained, desk has two large burn type marks etc.
All of this was confirmed when the Hotel Manager personally came to our room on hearing that we were leaving. He both saw and agreed with the issues we had raised. He offered an alternative room for us, but we declined. If this promotes itself as a 4 Star hotel then Ramada need to get a grip of management as they are not checking on the basics. There are far better, same priced hotels all round Jaipur.
ownerResponse/text:
Dear Paul H,

Greetings of the day & thank your sharing your feedback on Trip Advisor. 

I am saddened to see your feedback as at Ramada By Wyndham Raja Park Jaipur we take extra efforts to make our guests comfortable. At the same time I feel that we were unable to deliver a true Ramada Experience & hence would like to apologize for the same.   

I would like to also update that since you has changed your plans to stay at Ramada Raja Park , we have decided to refund the amounts to your travel agency , I request you to please speak to them or feel free to email me at gm@ramadajaipur.con incase you need any further assistance on the same.  

Again thank you for your feedback & we hope we are able to give you a great experience incase you wish to stay with us again.

Thanks,
placeInfo/address: Govind Marg Raja Park, Jaipur 302004 India

title: Shockingly bad experience. Zero ownership from Radisson or management.
text:
Very bad filthy hotel with zero ownership from management.
Reviews have been the same for over a year yet nothing changed. 
Radisson head office need to step in here and help to turn this place around.
I have been ill since staying here as place was covered in pigeon droppings, damp rooms and bedding, filthy everywhere, pool unusable, bird droppings all over bar area and fridges that was then opened at night. False advertising as pool area and room images on Radisson website are not indicative of the reality. 
We will be claiming full refund from Radisson and our credit card company for our two night stay due to false advertising and this place being a health hazard. 
Zero ownership from a very inexperienced management team.

title: Centrally located. Very hospitable and helpful service

Service is the must sought out in this place- the doorman, baggage boy, housekeeping and restaurant guys are always smiling and ready to help. placeInfo/address: D-194, Jagdish Marg, Banipark, Jaipur 302016 India

title: Overall ok
text: The experience was overall ok, the rooms were clean, the ambience was ok, and all important historical monuments like Hawa Mahal, and Jantar Mantar were near to it, but the restaurant service was not up to the mark and needs improvement..........
placeInfo/address: D-194, Jagdish Marg, Banipark, Jaipur 302016 India

title: Tre giorni a Jaipur
text: Per gli standard indiani, questo hotel è molto buono. La stanza pulita e spaziosa, anche se il bagno purtroppo non era proprio confortevole e l'arredamento un po' datata. Lo staff molto cordiale ed efficiente. La colazione è buona ma offre poca scelta oltre al cibo indiano.
placeInfo/address: D-194, Jagdish Marg, Banipark, Jaipur 302016 India

title: Keep it up
text: Beautiful property good good staff quik service and neat and clean rooms. Everything was Outstanding. Best part of hotel the hospitality which was top notch . Specially front office team. Keep it up team. Good luck
placeInfo/address: D-194, Jagdish Marg, Banipark, Jaipur 302016 India

title: Clean and comfortable  base for Jaipur
text: Excellent service, delicious extensive breakfast - all you require , tetley, cappuccino, Indian, eggs, cereal, toast, porridge, fresh juice,fruit. Clean comfortable rooms . Roof top restaurant with cultural entertainment and freshly cooked menu from Italy to China to India or  soup sandwich- all fresh and authentic dishes for c £3 per dish!  Pool looked good too! We would definitely return . Tuk-tuk into centre £1.
placeInfo/address: D-194, Jagdish Marg, Banipark, Jaipur 302016 India

title: Pleasant Stay
text:
We had a very nice stay at the Laxmi Palace Heritage Hotel. The staff were very pleasant and they were able to accommodate an early check-in as we arrived at 11:00am which was greatly appreciated. The room was large and had everything we needed. The air-conditioning worked well despite the very hot temperatures outside. We also found the bed to be very comfortable.

The value of this hotel was exceptional. The hotel was also very clean and met all of our expectations. The hotel is located off a main road so road noise was not much of an issue. The breakfast provided was also good, although we did not find there too be that many options. 

Overall, we are happy we stayed here and would be happy to stay here again.
placeInfo/address: D-194, Jagdish Marg, Banipark, Jaipur 302016 India

title: Excellent hotel rooms very comfortable and the overall ambience of the place was very nice
text: Awesome experience. The staff were very helpful. Breakfast average but the service staff very friendly. The manager went out of his way to get our next destination booking in order. The roof top restaurant was fantastic the food and staff. The cultural presentation was a bonus
placeInfo/address: D-194, Jagdish Marg, Banipark, Jaipur 302016 India

title: Mal honnête, dommage c'était bien.
text:
Très belle hôtel, propre, un peu loin du centre. Bon restaurant sur le toit avec spectacle et petit déjeuner varié. Par contre malhonnête 😭 3 jours sans clim l'effet constater 5 fois par le personnel et les responsables, et nous promettent de faire une remise sur la chambre assez cher mais finalement rien, malgré une longue discution. Attention aux taxer sur taxe dans tous les sens. Passer votre chemin, c'est dommage que les membres du personnel hormis les responsables à 
l'accueil  sont adorables. Dommage...
placeInfo/address: D-194, Jagdish Marg, Banipark, Jaipur 302016 India

title: Dont be fooled by th ename Palace, its not even a close to a motel !!
text: I stayed at this hotel with my family of 8 and it was the worst decision ever. They accused us of stealing a hand towel (by the way which is used piece of junk), asked us to open our bags and check and made us pay 120 rupees after we made a bill of 75K. The restaurant food was really bad and delivered the items after 30-40 min of ordering. Even if the rooms are available, they won’t let you do early check in even if you pay extra (I requested them very politely as my wife is pregnant, but still denied). Talking about the room, it’s below quality. No hot water and the towels are like super used and had bad stains. The fridge in the room is useless and it does not work at all. One more thing, if the place has a palace tag it does not mean it’s a palace. It looks new from outside but it’s super old from inside. The blankets, bed sheets, beds and all the other things are worn out and dirty. Don’t get fooled with their sweet greetings and faces. Their intentions and service are really bad. It’s not a 4 star hotel and it’s less than 2 star. Avoid this hotel at all costs!
placeInfo/address: D-194, Jagdish Marg, Banipark, Jaipur 302016 India

title: Good Area.  Great building.  Average hotel.
text: I could be being a little hard at 3 star because it is a lovely building in good area of the city.  Short, if inevitably chaotic, trip from the station and located right by a bus terminus.  Not that we were taking any buses but  you are guaranteed the hustle and bustle (and street food options) of an Indian City.  Beds were not as comfy as the other hotels we stayed at and staff not as engaging. Curiously the water in the room did not come on till 6:30 which was curious if you planned leaving early.
placeInfo/address: D-194, Jagdish Marg, Banipark, Jaipur 302016 India

title: Not as expected..first impression is last impression,front desk employees seems rude u can read face reading as my poi
text: The front desk seems erogant,otherwise other staff are very cooperative,rooms are. Clean and tide only things went wrong that food price are high and they can’t accept order after 11 o clock we have to roam around 11 o clock to bring milk for kids
placeInfo/address: D-194, Jagdish Marg, Banipark, Jaipur 302016 India

title: great location for a small conference
text: we had a group of 19 for a small conference and booked this hotel. We had a wonderful time. Staff is super friendly, helpful and proactive in meeting needs. Unlike other similar "Heritage" properties, they have a great meeting room downstairs that was perfect size for our group. Food was excellent. Special kudos to Mr. Bhannu who organized things for us and was super helpful in getting us set up.
placeInfo/address: D-194, Jagdish Marg, Banipark, Jaipur 302016 India

title: Highly Recommended
text: We stayed here for several days during our Jaipur visit. Staff are great. There is a night show started around 7pm on the roof top. They also got swimming pool where can relax after long hot day in the city. Will definitely book this hotel when we come back Jaipur.
placeInfo/address: D-194, Jagdish Marg, Banipark, Jaipur 302016 India

title: Toller Aufenthalt (nice stay)
text:
Die Zimmer sind sehr schön gestaltet, haben eine tolle Ausstattung und sind sauber. Das Personal ist nett und hilfsbereit. Die Zimmer im 3.OG sind leider recht hellhörig, man bekommt das Abendprogramm auf der Dachterasse deutlich mit. Da das Programm 22 Uhr endet, ist es vermutlich typsache, ob es einen stört. Uns wurde sofort ein Zimmertausch angeboten, als wir dies an der Rezeption bemerkten. Insgesamt war es ein wirklich schöner und empfehlenswerter Aufenthalt.

The rooms are designed very thoughtfully, the amenities are all well kept and the rooms are very clean. The hotel staff was helpful and considerate. During the evening show on the rooftop, the rooms below (on the third level) are a bit noisy. One can hear what is going on upstairs, but they stay within the show timings (10 pm). When we complained about this they immediately offered us rooms on a different floor. Overall it was a pleasant stay and we can recommend this hotel.
placeInfo/address: D-194, Jagdish Marg, Banipark, Jaipur 302016 India

title: Best stay in India!
text:
Amazing place - clean, nice, comfy beds, nice management.

Best value for money place we stayed in India!

Great for forigner as it’s up to international standards.

Breakfast has options (they are mostly indian) and they offer eggs of choice.

Nice rooftop where you can dine, and also watch live show.
placeInfo/address: D-194, Jagdish Marg, Banipark, Jaipur 302016 India

title: Buen hotel pero con detalles a mejorar.
text:
Estaba todo muy limpio, ordenado y en buen estado. Los trabajadores atendieron muy bien en todo momento. Localización cercana a la parada de metro y en transporte privado a 10 minutos del Hawa Mahal.

El último día la ducha dejó de echar agua caliente pero como teníamos prisa tampoco pudimos parar a quejarnos.

En la terraza tenían una zona restaurante con espectáculos de danza y música típicas de la zona. Pero éstos pasaban más tiempo pidiendo propinas que tocando y a medida que avanzaba la noche perdían el interés y las ganas. ¡Ni en nuestro propio hotel pudimos huir del acoso de dar propinas!

Además, el primer día no nos limpiaron la habitación porque no nos avisaron de que había que dejar las llaves antes de salir del hotel.
placeInfo/address: D-194, Jagdish Marg, Banipark, Jaipur 302016 India

title: Excellent hotel and awesome staff in Jaipur

Kudos to hotel staff for their immaculate behavior ! The rooftop dining was really cherry on cake. The only problem is is the approach road which at times get busy but nothing comes easy😁

title: The worst experience ever
text: So we booked our staying in this hotel through agoda.com. we chose to pay for our staying after we will check out. when we checked out at first they said that we dont need to pay any money, so I have signed in the papers and we were ready to left the hotel, when after a couple of minutes the manager called my name and told us that there was a mistake, and we need to pay 12000 rupees. And its not for food, not for drinks or something else. Just for staying. So we paid. In cash of course. They didnt gave us any check, or any papers. Because we didnt know if that was necessary. When we came home, back to Lithuania, we saw on our bank account, that agoda took from us 140 euros. We immediatly contacted both agoda and hotel. Agoda was the first one who took our money, so it means that we dont need to pay to hotel. The hotel is not answering already two months. Our family called them, and now they saying that we paid for food, and drinks. But we never eated at the hotel, never ordered any food to our room. Then we were drinking at the bar, we always paid in cash after we finish our drinks. Theres everywhere cameras which can prove that. So I guess manager just decided to use us, although we always leaved good tips after every help we needed. Still waiting for a problem solution, if not, we will just go to police. Its a shame that we cant fly to India again, because its too far, because than we can ask for cameras records. Tables, chairs, bed sheetings, everything was dirty. Some people of the staff was really helpful and sincere, but other ones, I dont have any words.
placeInfo/address: Station Road Near Central Bus Stand, Jaipur 302001 India

title: Average stay not worth the money
text:
Cons :

There is water dripping all day at a tap in the bathroom, the shower fuzzes and makes noise. We had to change rooms and waste half a day there after check-in.

An untidy room with lots of dust on the floor is what we got. Dimensions were not as described.

There is no ventilation in the washroom due to which there is discomfort after using it.

There were cockroaches everywhere.

The swimming pool was not accessible as there were private functions arranged.

The bath towels were pathetic. Cloth bobble remains on the body and clothes after usage. We had to use the roller to remove them later.

There was no mirror in the room, We had to use the one from the washroom.

Pros :

Near to the bus stand. And ease to access to local transport.

Near to all tourist attractions.

The food / Restaurant is good.

The hospitality of the staff is nice and welcoming.

The waiting area is huge and well-maintained.
placeInfo/address: Station Road Near Central Bus Stand, Jaipur 302001 India

title: STAY AWAY! IT IS A RUNNING SCAM!  Hyped room price, nothing in reality.
text:
Possibly the worst stay I have ever experienced in my life! 

To begin with, during Check-in the receptionist could not find my booking and started claiming I have to pay extra as I was booking at 3 AM. While for that particular reason I had booked my stay one day prior and on the day of booking. This took us almost 35-40 min at the reception standing, explaining him. 

Do not expect anyone to assist you to your room, and on reaching room you would be left for a quiz to find the main power switch. Which is freaking outside! 

We were staying in apparently ‘executive’ room. There was absolutely nothing executive about it but a cheap motel room. I cannot believe they are charging so much for the room. There is no functional AC in the room, just a noise that it is ON. No, Wifi or atleast our ‘executive’ room was not in the vicinity of the router. The staff was kind enough to reply ‘ Sir what can we do if you are not in the vicinity!’ To top it off, bathrooms are old, leaky, and without proper hygiene. 

Next morning, we requested for a room change where we could atleast have a working AC and Wifi. They said it is fully booked and showed us even worser room to which we decided to stay in the original one. 

In the room there is a bottle of water to invite you, but it is not sealed! As the room service said and quote ‘ bhaiya it is from R.O., apko mineral water chahiye to chargeable hoga’ WHAT? 😤 Nevertheless, we ordered one bottle of water and guess the price of it was ? 50 rupees!

Insanely pathetic experience and would never recommend to anybody!!! 

Let’s not be so cruel, good things: 

Good bed with white sheets! 🙂
placeInfo/address: Station Road Near Central Bus Stand, Jaipur 302001 India

title: Not safe for women
text: Not safe for women. The bell boy knocked on my door to give my friend the WiFi code. He walked into the room and kept saying kiss me. He wouldn’t leave the room. My friend had to push him outside. When we explained what happened the manager seemed to find it funny. Really awful situation and felt very vulnerable. Also the overall service was bad. They would hang the phone up when we called for room service, the food was awful. Would not stay again.

thing it takes around 1:30hr to them send in room. And that to u have to call them twice because when i first time place order then don’t communication to further then when get fade up and call where is my food they ohh give us some time will send soon.

title: Visite en Jaipur
text:
C’est un établissement qui vous propose une carte longues comme je sais pas quoi 
Mais quand tu commende il en rien la boisson en a demandé un cocktails avec alcool il est arrivé sans alcool en  a payé le même prix qu’avec alcool en nous 
En nous a dit il reste que de l’ l’agneau moi je mange pas de piment alors en lui a dit un normal et un sans piment il et revenu avec un un seul plat avec deux morceaux de viande et plein de sauce qui était épicé 200%
Donc je regarde mon mari manger et moi rien 
Et en a payé le même prix 
Arrive au moment de l’addition je donne ma carte visa international 
Il me dit Ça ne fonctionne pas je lui ai dit c’est une carte française réessayé ce n’est pas une carte américaine après cinq essais il me dit que sa machine elle est pas internationale je lui c’est pas mon problème vous me dit de payé moi je payé voilà ma carte 
Il dit ça marche pas il faut payé moi je juste une carte pas de espèces sur moi je dû aller à mon hôtel de faire une carte chez eux et l’hôtel leur a donné en espèces après c’est vraiment un hôtel et restaurant qui déconseille à tous le monde (il était à 14 personne à nous agresser verbalement )
Je aussi fait Delhi et agra tout c’est bien passé hôtel ou restaurant

title: Groped by drunk staff member in broad day light
text: Arrived back to the hotel at around 12pm after a morning celebrating holi festival with my boyfriend. Outside the hotel were around 5 members of staff including the manager that took us to our room a few days earlier and checked us in. They were all clearly drunk and started asking us for a photo with them. We were happy to have a photo with them but as soon as I smiled for the photo one of them grabbed my breast and when I slapped his hand off and told him no, he did it again! My boyfriend was furious - but he simply didn’t see there was a problem and followed us to the door asking for more photos. The manager and other staff members did and said nothing and so I didn’t feel comfortable complaining directly to the hotel, especially as none of them spoke very clear English for quite a sensitive matter! Will attempt to complain through tripadvisor and Agoda who I booked through but feel that nothing will be done about the matter. I can only hope that lone women travellers read this before staying with this hotel.
ownerResponse/text:
Dear guest...

Greetings..We are investigating the whole incident and will leave no stone unturned in punishing the guilty whoever it is.We will go to any extent to find the culprits. It was holi and people try to create nuisance but we assure you that whoever it is we will find him. Also if i could talk to you directly it would be easier for me to do the investigation.
placeInfo/address: Station Road Near Central Bus Stand, Jaipur 302001 India

title: False advertising! Filthy
text:
Pool area is a joke. False advertising on the Radisson website. They show a beautiful pool area and well furnished rooms however the reality is very different. Scruffy, dirty and nothing like the pictures. 
We complained about the state of the place however were met with contempt and denial. There is something very very wrong at this hotel with staffing, service and hygiene and cleanliness it is shocking. Don’t go to this hotel it is run down and a health hazard. 
Supposed to be 5 star, I wouldn’t give it 2 stars.
Pictures are of the pool area which show bird droppings all over the bar area, rusty fridges and derelict pool furniture and a pool that is so filthy that I would t get in if they paid me .
Rooms were scruffy with mismatched bedding, stains in bathroom that could easily be cleaned, dust everywhere, damp sheets, bird crap all over windows,  rubble inside the wire holes, dirty telephone and lighting pad that we didn’t want to touch as they were all sticky. 
Horrible experience that totally ruined our stay in Jaipur.
Management were useless and don’t seem to see the dirty state of the place, either they are in denial or they are very scared and feel intimidated by the top management,

title: AVOID unless you want to be ill
text:
Shocking service, dirty a health hazard AVOID!

We stayed here in this supposed 5star hotel as a couple. On arrival at the hotel I noticed it was very dirty, lots of dust and fingerprints everywhere like it hadn’t been cleaned for months.
We booked a King Business class room and were allocated a room on 6th floor overlooking the road. It was also very dirty with coffee stains next to the bed and rusting lamps, dirty bathroom and bird crap all over the windows and ledges. We were then moved to 724 which was pretty much the same, dirty. When I asked for the bathroom to be cleaned they simply sprayed some air freshener and left. The safe didn’t work and they just said sorry about that! 
The best part was when we decided to visit the pool area on the rooftop to relax after sightseeing in Jaipur. OMG this is a complete health hazard with pigeon droppings everywhere, a pool that has not been cleaned for months and a bar that looked derelict.We went to reception to complain and asked them about the pictures they were advertising on the website that were absolutely nothing like what we were seeing.
We were met with two managers housekeeping and a duty manager who simply said they were sorry to hear about our disappointment and left us in the lobby whilst they went to investigate for over 30mins.
They then retuned to say they had put 2 subbed at the pool for us. However as I considered it to be a health hazard I shared that we would not be visiting again only to take photos of the place.I also at this point showed the housekeeping manager all the dust under the tables and he just laughed!
They offered me a 10% discount on food and drinks I had in the bar, I already had this as a Platinum member of the Radisson club and shared that as the hotel was so dirty I had decided to eat and drink elsewhere. Very poor service from management who seemed weak and ineffective with little knowledge of how to deal with complaints or customer service issues. 
As I was complaining another guest in the lobby shouted to the manager that she also agreed with everything I had said and that she had been suffering with damp sheets, no fridge and an allergic reaction since she checked in here.

title: Horrible experience at Radisson Blu
text:
This was one of the worst experiences I’ve ever had at a so-called five-star property.  The first room allotted stank of dampness and stale air. The second room wasn’t any better no electricity, no hot water, and no coffee sachets. When I tried to reach housekeeping by dialing 0, there was no response at all.

The breakfast was an absolute mess no plates, no cutlery, empty food trays, and it took an hour to get a cappuccino. The spa was terrible no hair dryer, the massage oil was cold, and there was no soft music, and the steam room had no light completely ruining the experience. The pool was in horrible condition, dirty, surrounded by pigeons and their droppings, with no shade or proper pool chairs, just tarps thrown over them.

The food itself was good and the restaurant staff were polite, but everything else front office, housekeeping, and maintenance was a disaster. This property desperately needs a management overhaul. Absolutely unacceptable for Radisson Blu.

title: Very Disappointing Stay – Not Worth the Money
text:
Very Disappointing Stay – Not Worth the Money

I had one of the worst hotel experiences during my stay here.
	•	The room was not clean – the bedsheet had stains, and the bathroom was not properly maintained. Even the shower tap was not working.
	•	We had booked the MAP plan, but there were no starters in the buffet. Starters had to be ordered and paid for separately. The dinner food was also served cold.
	•	The staff was unfriendly and did not seem interested in assisting guests, which made the experience even more unpleasant.

Overall, I found the hotel poorly managed and not guest-friendly. Definitely not a place I would recommend or return to.
ownerResponse/text:

title: Clean but noisy
text:
Whilst there were some positives to this hotel such as it was clean, had a good location and good food (and excellent restaurant staff), I would probably not recommend staying here. 

I experienced an extremely noisy hotel. One particularly frustrating night, a member of staff was sanding the paint on the walls outside my room (and other rooms) at 9:30pm at night. When I tried to communicate with the staff that it was loud and preventing me from sleeping, staff were dismissive and said that it would continue until at least 10:30pm. Not sure why this maintenance was not carried out during the daytime so as not to disturb the guests.  

Definitely not worth the amount paid for zero sleep. 

Overall, if you choose to stay here, byo earplugs and eye mask (for the bright lights that shine into the bedrooms from the corridor)
placeInfo/address: D-194, Jagdish Marg, Banipark, Jaipur 302016 India

title: Clean hotel

title: Arguably the best and excelled stay

Important note: do visit their rooftop restaurant for dinner exactly at 8-9pm, you should not miss their own dance crew and they were stunning and music carries us away with the amazing roof top view of jaipur

title: Rigid and unfriendly reception
text: Very bad experience , even after staying for 4 nights and checking in v late and checking out v early they were very v rigid when we requested them to give us a room for 2 hours just to rest before we left to airport . We were 3 ladies alone and we had a late night flight and we had checked our early too.  They made us sit at the reception even though they had empty rooms, they asked for rs 1500 for using room for2 hrs inspite of the fact that we stayed for 4 nights!!Will never recommend this hotel to anyone as they are not customer friendly
ownerResponse/text:
Dear Guest, 

Thanks for considering and staying with us during your recent visit to jaipur. We also appreciate your effort towards sharing your feedback on public platform which makes easier for others to find best accommodation for them.

As per your feedback we would like to inform you that we were running sold out and that time we have only one room available which is booked for another guest, however we have managed the thing and we have offered you room with very less charges  since you were not ready to make the payment, being in service industry we  had offer you the room free of cost for couple of hours but then you denied taking the room.

Being in service industry our goal is to make sure every guest is satisfied with our services and getting such feedback always gear-up.

Looking forward to serve you in near future. 

Regards, 
Team Laxmi Palace

title: Beautiful boutique hotel but not great service
text:
The property is of a 3 star standard rather than 4 star. We had booked the Suite but my kids were bitten at night by mosquitoes quite a lot. We later realised the mosquito repellant in the room was empty. This should have been checked prior to check in.

Service at restaurant was a little abrupt and rude. I ordered a tea one night but it was 45 minutes and it still did not arrive. When i said i would like to cancel it as my kids were tired and needed to get them to bed (it was at 10.30pm) they refused to cancel, so i had to leave but they still charged me for it in my final bill. I couldnt be asked to argue about a cup of tea payment, but it just showed a shoddy service.

Also on The final morning we had a flight so had to leave the hotel 15 mins before breakfast time started and had requested if we could have a small packed breakfast for my kids but was straight out refused , as they said breakfast starts at 6.30pm (we requested to get a small packed breakfast for the kids at 6.15am!) So despite us paying for a room with inclusive breakfast we were not able to avail it in our final morning. Its just these little things that the hotel lacked in- customer service.

Eventhough the property is beautiful, i would not recommend it to my family and friends as was slightly let down by the service.
placeInfo/address: D-194, Jagdish Marg, Banipark, Jaipur 302016 India

title: Reasonable price
text: Staff was very friendly and helpful.  Food in the hotel restaurant was absolutely delicious but only two dishes was available that time probably because of covid 19 . My room was clean ,with AC and shower. Outside pool not too big but definitely good enough . Relatively quiet neighborhood around the hotel.

title: Budget Jaipur Hotel Experience
text: The hotel is located close to the bus stand making it well connected. it's walkable from the main road and is connected with Rickshaws also. The rooms are done tastefully and the lobby/waiting area is quiet cozy too. The breakfast was just okay and i would rather suggest travellers to try local cuisine outside. the Jaipur fort is well connected and a must visit if you are staying here. The evening dinner has local artists performance at the rooftop.

title: Best hotel have ever stayed
text: We had an amazing stay, the hotel is situated in a quiet area and has a pool, both being more than welcomed when visiting buzzing Jaipur in a very hot day. The room was big, clean and the room service and food were both really great. The staff was amazingly helpful and kind, helped us organize the rest of our trip and generally made our stay relaxing and enjoyable thanks to their attention. I highly recommend Laxmi Palace, and would definitely come back there. You also have some tuktuk drivers waiting a bit further from the hotel, we took some and they were great, saving you from going to the main road where it's crazier. Everything in and around for a hassle-free stay.

title: Very nice hotel but quite noisy
text:
Stayed here for 2 nights in Feb 2020, the hotel itself is lovely, the decor is beautiful, the rooms are spacious and clean and the beds are comfortable. The staff are very accommodating and the restaurant food is pretty good. 

The breakfast buffet has quite a few options to choose from but don't expect the same kind of spread you would get in Europe/USA etc. Most of the food is Indian but fruit, cereal, bread, eggs are available. 

The one downside of this hotel was the noise. My room faced the main street and the traffic is super heavy from about 4am. In India, everyone beeps their horn, constantly, so the noise can be quite distracting if you're a light sleeper. 

If you plan to visit, maybe request a quiet room to avoid being woken up through the night. 

Other than that, I really enjoyed my stay here, the location is great! Would stay here again. 

Hope this helps!

title: Poor internet, limited hot water, poor communication
text: The hotel staff were very kind to let us check in early on the day of our arrival. Do not expect a reply to requests for transport from the train station or airport, we sent 3 messages via the booking platform and got no response at all, luckily we had access to Uber. The internet is woeful, unable to even load the most basic of webpages in our room or in common areas eg the restaurant. We had to request that hot water be accessible in our room for showers and it was only just warm. The rooftop bar is non existent, just a space without seating and rubbish everywhere. The downstairs bar is dark and cash only, the staff eventually agreed to add the charge to our hotel bill. The included breakfast is ok, you can request eggs cooked to your liking. Bottled water was not provided. The TV is very limited with most channels not available, especially the English speaking ones.The location is ok but be aware you will be hassled by tuk tuk drivers the minute you step out the door, admittedly this is normal for India. Overall, if this hotel wants to attract international travellers some improvements need to be made as the advertised inclusions are not what is advertised on platforms such as Agoda and Booking.com.

title: Below average stay
text: Was here last week for 5 nights.Although the overall review for this hotel was not good,I still thought of giving it a try and booked suite room.The hotel staff is normal, neither friendly nor rude. The location is a very plus point, next to central bus stand and in a busy area, and close to the old city. getting rickshaws and taxis is very much easy with a prepaid rickshaw counter nearby. The room is below average old style one, with centralized AC, which doesnt cool to the extent required. the ceiling was licking due to AC condensation. Fridge was ok. bathroom is good. no toiletry provided, only shampoo and cream. there is no faucet pipe in the toilet.lifts, reception is all good. Food is tasty and nice in their restaurant, and so was the complimentary breakfast, but the prices for dishes are higher and costly i felt. Coudnt use the pool as it was closed for all the days I was in there. Pool timings are 7AM-7PM. bed and sofas has damp smell, but manageable.The hotel staff is old styled and should adjust to the new concepts of hospitality. Over all good, but below average stay.

title: behind the times
text:
this was probably a really nice hotel a long time ago, but is now quite dated, and the staff although very friendly, seem completely untrained, or lacking in authority to do anything.
It took ages for anything to happen and getting food served at breakfast or dinner was a nightmare.
Our bedroom was basic, but location is fine and in the centre of town.
We would look for somewhere else if we were to visit Jaipur again but for a couple of nights it was clean and safe.

title: With better management this hotel could be truly average
text: First some positives. The rooms are a decent size and the beds are comfortable, from the outside the building is impressive as indeed are the communual areas. But the negatives outweigh these factors. The rooms we were given were quite shabby and had not been deep cleaned for a long time. Neither the bath nor  the wash basin came with a plug and like the hair dryer were only obtained after repeated requests. More seriously the hotel does not supply free bottled water in the rooms; there was a report within our group that the water purchased came in refilled bottles not unopened ones. Lastly it seems about 30% of items on the a la carte menu cannot be supplied. Overall suggestion is to avoid this one if you can.

title: We're not planning to visit again anytime soon
text:
The rooms are clean and well presented however, we were unhappy with this hotel for many reasons. The bus depot is right outside the hotel so you have announcements going from very early morning so best to ask for a room at the back of the hotel. We booked and paid for 3 rooms to occupy 11 guests and on departure were asked to pay for an extra 3 beds. The restaurant never ever gave us the right change, we ended up having to demand the correct change. This happened everytime We dined except for room service. 
I put some washing in and marked on the form clearly what I sent, they made changes without any consultation as per their form and charged more. Our overall stay as a family was not great. I will say however that house keeping staff were friendly and helpful.

title: Nice hotel and polite staff!!!
text: The hotel is situated near the railway station and is close to the market. The hotel has a great look from outside. My stay was for a short span for for few hours in 1 night. The room which I was given was on the backside of the hotel and was big, however, lacks ventilation, due glass covering the entire gallery. The hotel is beautiful but it is not airy if you are planning to stay in the rooms which are on the backside. The glasses provide soundproofing and security, however, the stop ventilation. Staff was very polite and helpful and they helped whole heartedly while check-in and check-out. Over all it was a nice stay.

title: Very Pleasant Stay

title: Redelijk hotel
text: Als je binnenkomt, doet het hotel sjiek aan. Werkelijk is wat anders. Zeker de kamer. Was redelijk. Ontbijt is wel prima. 250 roepies. WiFi (gratis) is slecht in het hotel. Dicht bij de lobby blijven dus. Verder het Holy festival in de stad gevierd. In het hotel wordt het ook gevierd. Mijd het!!! Met name het deel dat voor de Indiërs wordt geregeld. Zijn rond het middaguur knetter dronken en vallen je als vrouw lastig. Precies recht tegenover het hotel zitten een paar eettentjes met een dakterras. Leuk voor het diner. Kost wat, heb je ook wat.
placeInfo/address: Station Road Near Central Bus Stand, Jaipur 302001 India

title: An elegant hotel

title: Poor Wifi Signal & Bad lighting Washroom
text: Very poor wifi signal in room, cause me to be in lobby most of the time to use internet. Wifi is only working in lobby near reception counter.Toilet is very dark with only one light working.. Dusty curtain & bed sheet. The only plus point of staying here is near bus stop & indoor restaurant. I hope hotel management will improve their service.
placeInfo/address: Station Road Near Central Bus Stand, Jaipur 302001 India

title: Convenient For Bus/Train
text: We were only in town for one night travelling by train so this was a convenient location.  Unfortunately it is situated in a dirty busy part of town so there is not really any other location appeal other than proximity to bus / train stations.  We arrived very early in the morning so it was nice that they made our room available on our arrival.   However the room had a distinct and unpleasant smell to it.  The wall had a switch for AC but nothing to modulate the temperature.  We had a bath tub for those who like to have one, not really a big deal to me.  Generally clean and service was ok with an ok breakfast.  Staff do not speak English very well.  A functional hotel with little charm.

title: Excellent Food Specially Chef Rajendra
text:
Feedback on Day Conference at Ramada, Raja Park Jaipur – 29th July (Nestlé Event)

We organized a day conference on behalf of Nestlé at Ramada Hotel, Raja Park, Jaipur on 29th July. We opted for the lunch in the outdoor area, and I must say, the food was absolutely fantastic.

Special compliments to the Palak Paneer, Red Thai Curry, Chicken Korma, Dal Dhaba, and Dum Aloo Bhojpuri – everything was delicious and truly appreciated by our entire team.

I, Satyam, was the coordinator for this day conference, and I’m extremely satisfied with the overall arrangements. A special thanks to Chef Rajendra, the Executive Chef of the hotel, whose warm behavior and cooperation made our experience even better. He ensured that the food was prepared exactly as we requested, which speaks volumes about his professionalism and commitment.

I would like to extend my heartfelt thanks to Chef Rajendra and the entire Ramada Raja Park Jaipur team. I look forward to coming back again for future events.

Warm regards,
Satyam
placeInfo/address: Govind Marg Raja Park, Jaipur 302004 India

title: Skip staying at Ramada by Wyndham
text:
The stay at Wyndham has gone from bad to worse with the hospitality equivalent of a Third Grade Hotel

There was no welcome at checkin neither the luggage was escorted further the receptionist was callous and rude unaware of Wyndham rewards Diamond status

The Room 219 allotted was stinking bad from the smell of liquor and smoking so I had to change the Room to 218

There was no bathing liquid soap for 2 days and the housekeeping didn’t replenish until the 3rd day

The In-room dining menu is extremely limited with no local delicacy

The breakfast was limited with fewer options compared to similar Ramada Hotels in India

The receptionist was reduce and callous and refused for Late Checkout.

The Hotel Manager Deepak was equally Callous and defensive when given with the feedback and refused to take it.

This is my last stay in a Wyndham property in India and I’ll stick to Marriott and Radisson you guys cannot match them.
placeInfo/address: Govind Marg Raja Park, Jaipur 302004 India

È posizionato sulla via piu trafficata di tutta jaipur ed è quasi impossibile camminare nei dintorni.
Ok solo se viaggia con i bus di linea perche è attaccato alla stazione!
Sicuramente a Jaipur ci sono molte soluzioni più carine!

title: Leuk hotel

De kamers zijn zeer mooi, typisch Indisch. Wel mogen ze de vloer eens stofzuigen want die is zanderig, ook hangt er een muffe geur in de kamer. Voor de rest is de badkamer wel wat verouderd en kan een opknapbeurt gebruiken. Omdat het hotel niet bij een drukke straat ligt, heb je hier geen last van lawaai en kan je goed slapen. Het ontbijt valt wel mee, als je een omelet wil, kan je die altijd vragen aan de vriendelijke obers. Al bij al een goed hotel.

title: A really bad experience
text:
This hotel is incredibly overpriced for the provided services. We only paid half price because of an online offer but even then the price is way overrated even for India. The swimming pool is closed, no hot water, no wifi in the rooms and only in some places and sometimes in the hotel lobby (we were told that we were "lucky" not to pay 550 Rs per day for a wifi that does not even exist...). There was water coming out of the toilets, quickly drowning the bathroom. We asked to change rooms as soon as we arrived because it was way too dirty, and the new room was a little bigger but just as dirty. It was really late so we finally went to bed. After all that, we asked to pay less than the initial price and we were (not so) kindly asked to simply check out. 
The breakfast was a buffet which was good, with Indian food and the staff really nice and dedicated to us.
ownerResponse/text:
Dear Guest,

Thank you for taking your precious time to rate us on Trip Advisor.

We are concerned regarding the shortcomings you highlighted , which are being taken up with the concerned associates in order to take corrective measures for the future.

Due to erractic monsoons in July we had to close the pool.We regret the fact that the room and the bathroom was not up to the standard you had expected from us . We will put in more efforts in fulfilling the gap that guest expect from us. 

Also the wi-fi works but sometimes there is a failure from the telecom provider.

In the interim, please feel free to write to me on md@fortchandagupt.com should you need to share any other comments that will help us make the guest stay experience an impeccable one.

title: An average hotel that needs a lot of improvement.
text: We arrived at the hotel.  I'll mention from the front it opens up to a sketchy area in Jaipur.  Upon arrival, we were treated rudely by customer service.  They acted as if they didn't want us to stay.  Then, they only gave us one room even though we had already paid for two.  After reminding them with the receipt we printed out beforehand, they gave us two rooms.  Our rooms were dirty, and had mold on the walls.  My bathroom wasn't clean, and there was no shower curtain.  Enjoy using the toilet in your shower puddles.  Worst of all, the toilet had remaining ""material"" from whomever last used it on the toilet ring and I had to clean it myself.  This isn't an attack on the hotel, but just an outline of things they can definitely improve in the future as well as a forewarning to future guests.  We left immediately to the Fourt Points Sheraton across the city.
ownerResponse/text:
Dear Guest,

Thank you for taking your precious time to rate us on Trip Advisor.

We are concerned regarding the shortcomings you highlighted , which are being taken up with the concerned associates in order to take corrective measures for the future.

With reference to the confusion regarding the number of rooms booked and actually handed over to you it is an error from the hotel's side and we sincerely apologize for the same.  

   We regret the fact that the room and the bathroom was not up to the standard you had expected from us . We will put in more efforts in fulfilling the gap that guest expect from us.Although we do provide shower curtains in the rooms but if it was missing we surely will take an action.

      In the interim, please feel free to write to me on md@fortchandagupt.com should you need to share any other comments that will help us make the guest stay experience an impeccable one.

title: Nice hotel horrible location
text: Stayed as part of a tour & the hotel itself is quite nicely decorated, clean rooms with comfortable beds plus there is a treat of (if a tiny bit dirty) swimming pool. Considering it is literally right next to the main Jaipur bus station it was surprisingly quiet in the rooms (overlooking the courtyard/car park). The issue is its location, it is in a dirty, crowded, dodgy part of Jaipur & not really close to the old city or anything else for that matter. would not stay again because of the location
placeInfo/address: Station Road Near Central Bus Stand, Jaipur 302001 India

title: Nice bussiness stay
text:
I was there for business from 5th Feb to 8th Feb 2016 . The rooms were spacious and clean .  The quality of food were excellent . In breakfast ,there was  not much variety , but it was good . Free wi-fi was available there.
Hotel management and service were good. Overall a very nice hotel in heart of city.
placeInfo/address: Station Road Near Central Bus Stand, Jaipur 302001 India

title: Not too bad
text:
This hotel is pretty centrally based for getting about and restaurants are all within walking distance. 
The shop two doors up sell beautiful saris but the shop in the hotel not only changes your currency at a good rate but they sell stunning saris and gifts at a cheaper price than shops around. Unusual for a hotel shop but trust me it's worth a visit.
The bar in the basement however is a must to avoid. Locals smoking in a dark large room looking at you like your from mars. Expensive too. My advice would be visit an alcohol shop on your way back from being out and about. A tuk tuk will always be willing to help out.
placeInfo/address: Station Road Near Central Bus Stand, Jaipur 302001 India

title: Service was terrible
text:

We got our room and their wifi wasnt working (while travelling its very disturbing as we had to book for trains). They said their wifi has a problem. However at 9pm when we asked for refund that they gave us another room with wifi...
Anyway, i am sure this place used to be nice but its not worth it for that price. Rooms are not well maintained either. 
Bonus point for the luggages porter, very nice man.

title: Bit Unprofessional / slow room service
text: We had booked the 3 Royal suits in advance (almost 4 days) before arriving there. Also confirmed about the booking once we were on the way. Still as we arrived at hotel we found they had given one of our suits to someone else and we got 2 royal suits and 1 executive room. This was first and really bad experience we get. Then the other 2 royal suits were not having of same standard , one room is having curtains other one not..one is having center table other one not having...  Refrigerators of one room was not working......... one of family with us is having extra person with them ..for that they had already paid... we requested extra bed for them... it took 3-4 calls and 2-3 hrs to arrange this... Rooms were clean but no scope of ventilation .. Next day one our continuous follow-up we get our rooms...Room service staff was polite but service time they took was bit on higher side... Breakfast buffet was good but again the service was very very slow.......... Dinner was so-so.. Overall not impressed by place...
placeInfo/address: Station Road Near Central Bus Stand, Jaipur 302001 India

title: Wonderful experience!
text: We checked in late but personnel was very friendly and welcoming.Beautiful decor in hotel, rooms very comfy and clean. Lovely food and very good breakfast. Very nice and very affordable shop inside the hotel.Really a very good experience overall.
placeInfo/address: Station Road Near Central Bus Stand, Jaipur 302001 India

title: Best travel expirience in Jaipur, in a real sense service with smile and wonderful immersion in tradition and culture.
text: Decor of the room and type of furniture was cozy elegant,the food was outstanding. The staff were courteous and polite. Always willing to assist. Being   NewYorker,was skeptical  ,but they won my heart, beyond expectation.
placeInfo/address: Station Road Near Central Bus Stand, Jaipur 302001 India

title: Best hotel
text: Food, services, quality, quantity, all these r best in class in here .. the ambience is marvelous  ....              but pls improve AC cooling in ALL ROOMS     ..... One of my best memorable experience i had until now was this one with all the antique furniture placed accordingly. .
placeInfo/address: Station Road Near Central Bus Stand, Jaipur 302001 India

title: Хороший отель
text: Для Индии прилично и чисто. Приветливый и вышколенный персонал, уютная терраса, все на хорошем уровне. В номерах чисто. По ночам в Джайпур выходить не рекомендуется, поэтому коротать вечера возле бассейна или на терраске самое то.
placeInfo/address: Station Road Near Central Bus Stand, Jaipur 302001 India

title: SERVICE NEEDS A SERIOUS ATTENTION
text:
It's been about 3 years we have been having our retailer's conference at this hotel. This time the service was horrible. To get a water bottle, I tried asking politely, firmly, even threatened to blacklist the hotel . This continued from 11 pm to 8 am, but the reception incharge was enjoying aggravating the situation.
Finally I gave up, and got it from the market. The GM of the hotel Mr.PuranSingh, was more than apologetic and wanted to makeup for the bad experience, but at times I get irritated beyond compromise levels.
He is a dynamic and very caring person, but a couple of irresponsible staff are enough to ruin things. The GM needs to completely overhaul the work force to get things on track, once again.
placeInfo/address: Station Road Near Central Bus Stand, Jaipur 302001 India

title: Good for a stopover
text:
I stayed here for 2 nights whilst travelling and it was good for what I needed - somewhere to rest my head. The room was clean and cool and the shower room was above average. 
We were greeted on arrival with drinks and floral chains with a woman putting tikkas on our forehead which was a nice touch.
I went in the pool for about 20 minutes one afternoon - that was about all I could stand. It wasn't very clean!
The location of the hotel was spot on, very close to the pink city and just a short tuk tuk ride from most places of interest (the amber fort is a little way away).
The bar is nice inside or you can sit outside on the grass next to the water feature - don't expect great table service though, you'll be waiting a while!
placeInfo/address: Station Road Near Central Bus Stand, Jaipur 302001 India

title: Convenient Location
text: Must have been a great property once upon a time. Nice efforts to maintain its Royalty but it still demands a lot. Typical Rajasthani ambience - touch of tradition, culture and Royalty. We had a nice and comfortable stay here during our visit in Dec 2011 - Jan 2012. Though the dining hall is spacious, food options for breakfast were limited. Room service was better. Shops inside the Hotel are genuine and nice.
placeInfo/address: Station Road Near Central Bus Stand, Jaipur 302001 India

title: Was likely once a really fine hotel
text: The hotel has very charming gates upon approach and a nice courtyard. The staff greated us with drinks and made us feel very welcome in a lobby that exudes the style of hotels of the past (large/marble). There is a shop in the lobby that sells reasonably priced low end tourist gear. The public bathrooms in this hotel are horrible though and speak to the larger issues with the hotel. That is, the hotel  appears nicer than it is due to the marble work of the hotel. The rooms are large but the furnishings have seen better days and could certainly use dusting and replacement. My room looked out on the busy bus terminal area but the windows were covered wtih filth and pigeon droppings on the outside. As for amenities, massages are quite inexpensive and good at this place and the restauarant's chef was very gracious. The pool area is attractive but the water has the stench of sewer so I wouldn't recommend a swim in it.
placeInfo/address: Station Road Near Central Bus Stand, Jaipur 302001 India

title: Correct. Un peu loin de tout...
text:
Cet hôtel nous a plutôt positivement surpris. Les chambres sont assez spacieuses et l'entretient semble suivi. Le personnel est aux petits soins. 
Côté négatif le wifi coûte une fortune et ne fonctionne pas toujours de surcroît. Même si en distance on est pas loin du centre, il n'y a pas de route pour accéder à celui-ci. On a donc droit à chaque fois a pas mal de bouchons...
placeInfo/address: Station Road Near Central Bus Stand, Jaipur 302001 India

title: ok place near the old city
text: my room was clean and cool.  AC worked fine as did the Cable TV.  The only thing I did not like was that some of the staff followed you up to your room with out saying a word. This was kind of creepy.  Bar on site, so grab a cold beer and hang with the local guys.
placeInfo/address: Station Road Near Central Bus Stand, Jaipur 302001 India

title: Part of tour group
text: Stayed here for a couple of nights with tour group.  Jaipur is a very busy place.  Lots going on all around.  Hotel was quite old - baths were made of marble.  Water not so hot.  Quiet rooms.  Clean, tidy and comfortable.  Wi-fi was chargeable.  Restaurant in hotel - reasonable.  Outdoor pool.
placeInfo/address: Station Road Near Central Bus Stand, Jaipur 302001 India

title: Fuyez! !
text: Nous venons de quitter cet hôtel ou nous avons dormi deux nuits. hôtel situé dans un quartier crasseux et loin de la Pink city.chambre sale et bruyante sur la rue ,  service inexistant, accueil glacial sauf le portier qui est charmant, wifi payant à raison de 3 euros de l heure, draps uses jusqu a la corde ( nous avons demandé leur changement sans succes), serviettes de toilettes avec tâche de rouille, jaunatres et douteuses. Bref un très mauvais souvenir. A fuir
placeInfo/address: Station Road Near Central Bus Stand, Jaipur 302001 India

title: Good hotel
text: Rooms were very big, comfortable, clean, felt secure, reception staff good and were welcomed with a welcome drink which was a nice touch, close to some facilities, took rickshaw into town centre where we attended a Bollywood movie which was nice,
placeInfo/address: Station Road Near Central Bus Stand, Jaipur 302001 India

title: Visit to jaipur
text:
Good hotel
Good city
Friendly loving people
Loved the culture 
Really a city to be visited
Atleast two days are required to visit the  complete city.
For nearby city like ajmer amd pushkar one day extra is required. This makes a four day tour.
placeInfo/address: Station Road Near Central Bus Stand, Jaipur 302001 India

title: Hôtel vieillot!
text:
Hôtel situé dans un quartier très populaire. Évitez de sortir de l'hôtel le soir !piscine sur terrasse pas très nette. Wifi payante et chère. 
L'hôtel propose des massages et un spa très chers aussi . Les chambres sont d'un confort moyen, avec de très petites  fenêtres qu'on peut à peine ouvrir. Évitez les chambres côté rue car très bruyantes. Hôtel fréquenté surtout par des cadres et hommes d'affaires indiens qui sont bruyants et alcoolisés, le bar étant en rez de chaussée. Petit déjeuner et repas correct même si les boissons sont chères. Trouvez un autre hôtel même pour une nuit.
placeInfo/address: Station Road Near Central Bus Stand, Jaipur 302001 India

title: 3 mars 2015
text:
Bel hôtel, super accueil. Décoration à l'ancienne. Chambre spacieuse,propre, mur venant être repeint. Salle de bain vieillotte,pas de sèche-cheveux. Manquait les serviettes de toilette.
Bonne literie, eau de la piscine suspecte, verte... change dans la boutique de l'hôtel.
Par contre, l'hôtel se trouve dans une rue bruyante, sale, pas de boutique, loin du centre, dans le quartier de la quincaillerie.
petit déjeuné typiquement indien, café solube
placeInfo/address: Station Road Near Central Bus Stand, Jaipur 302001 India

title: enjoyed stay
text: awesome experience with family ... good friendly  behaviour... nice heritage property value for money and and feeling like kings and queens palace ... food was nice and staffs are friendly and so cooperative
placeInfo/address: Station Road Near Central Bus Stand, Jaipur 302001 India

title: Not bad
text:
It's a budget - friendly hotel. At this rate, we can't really expect better than this. 
Rooms were clean, furniture and mattress were good too. 
Restaurant was okay and it had very limited breakfast options. 
Hotel location is too busy but some beautiful places to see are not really far from the hotel.  
Just one thing which should be improved is the staff who needs to be more friendly and more courteous. 
Cheers!
placeInfo/address: Station Road Near Central Bus Stand, Jaipur 302001 India

title: 小綺麗なホテル
text:
部屋はそんなに広くはなかったですが、綺麗に掃除されており、安心して過ごせました。インド1つ目ののホテルではトイレットペーパーがなく、2つ目のホテルは1ロール、こちらは2ロール置いてありました（笑）
バスルームは十分な広さがあり、大きな鏡、大きなバスタブもありました。ただ、シャワーヘッドもガタガタで、水圧も不安定でぬるい！今までのホテルにはあった、バケツとオケがない上に、バスタブが石造りでとても冷たく寒さで震えながらシャワーをしました。
朝食でトーストを食べようと思ったらトースターがなかったので、スタッフの方に聞いたら厨房でトーストしたパンを持ってきてくれました。ついでコーヒーもお願いしたところ快く対応してくださいました。
ちなみに、こちらのホテルては両替はできませんでした。
placeInfo/address: Station Road Near Central Bus Stand, Jaipur 302001 India
