title: Not a pleasant one
text:
Buffet spread was not great
Just three  juices - only one was a  fresh one. Twice I had breakfast  yesterday it was almost  a semi stale water melon juice and today it was a similar mixed fruit juice. Look like they used yesterday's unused cut fruits and made a juice  

I reported to the restaurant manager, he has promise to give me a fresh orange juice now. I'm writing this sitting in the restaurant   (13/09/2025)

Today morning I asked for an iron box   The room had an ironing  table but no iron box. (The ironing table was dirty- I have shared its picture here) The lady in the front office, ask my room number and my name, and cut the line without even telling me if she's sending inbox.  
I called again, a gentleman picked up this time, (I understand the earlier ladies name was Himani from him), I told him about my experience. He apologised and promised to send me an iron box, which of course came after 15 minutes.  

I may not like to stay in this Radisson Blu again  
Dear administration, 
I know it is not easy, to make it good for the customer. Customers are of various stripes. 
But I am sure, you can try to make it better
(Eg: A little bit of gentlemess and pleasantness training to people like Himani)
All the best
ownerResponse/text:
Dear Guest,

Thank you for your recent stay with us at Radisson Blu Jaipur.

We sincerely appreciate that you took the time to share the feedback on your recent stay with us. We are deeply sorry to hear about the feedback and we will definitely look into improving the issues you have raised. We apologise for the shortfalls.

Our team certainly looks forward to the opportunity to re-establish your trust in our standards of quality and have many more opportunities to serve you.

Warm Regards,
Hotel Management
Radisson Blu Jaipur

title: Da evitare assolutamente
text: Da una catena Occidentale 5 stelle, anche se ci si trova in mezzo all'India, certi standard devono essere rispettati! Le camere erano assolutamente inaccettabili, ce ne hanno fatte vedere tre ( Suite essendo un cliente premium), ma tutte era umide e freddissime. Il sistema do condizionamento non funzionava a causa delle piogge?? Il probema è che tutte avevanp un odore di muffa ed umiditá stagnante, i divani, le lenzuola i cuscini il pavemento erano bagnati... il problema era che sopra una certa temperatura, 18 gradi!!!  il condizionamento fermava la deumidificazio e tutto si impregnava di umidità insana. Quindi abbiamo aimè dormito per avere un pò di aria respirabile a 18 gradi, mia moglie al mattino aveva la tosse. Abbiamo abbandonato l'hotel prima del tempo e non tormeremo in futuro.

title: Poor experience at radison blu
text:
During checkout, I was charged for extra snacks that I did not consume. I had clearly informed the staff about the snacks I actually had, and I paid for those without any issue. However, they insisted on charging me for other items I never touched. It felt as though they did not trust my word, which was very disappointing.

As a guest who willingly acknowledged and paid for what I consumed, I find it unreasonable to be questioned over a small amount (₹150) when I had booked a full room at your property. This experience left a poor impression, as I value honesty and expected the same from the hotel staff.
ownerResponse/text:
Dear Guest,

Thank you for your recent stay with us at Radisson Blu Jaipur.

We sincerely appreciate that you took the time to share the feedback on your recent stay with us. We are deeply sorry to hear about the feedback and we will definitely look into improving the issues you have raised. We apologise for the shortfalls.

Our team certainly looks forward to the opportunity to re-establish your trust in our standards of quality and have many more opportunities to serve you.

Warm Regards,
Hotel Management
Radisson Blu Jaipur

title: Good Hotel, Average Service
text:
This is an unbiased review.
The hotel location might not be good (being its proximity to bus stand) but it is helpful for people who need to catch buses/volvo without any hassle.
The exteriors needs some work but the interiors are well maintained. The room 211 which I was alloted is a nice room with pool view. The interiors are nice and has everything one need while staying.
The room and toilet was clean however the towels need to be replaced as they seems to be overused.
The bed makes a lotta nice and needs to be repaired so that one can sleep quietly. The mattress is good.
In a nutshell, my advise for travellers - this is good for a budget traveller and you can go for it. The advise of hotel management is - You have a good property and a good system. Just invest more in the service and staff. Train them well so that service can be made quick.

Rest all like food and restaurant is nice. However the variety in the breakfast is a little limited.
placeInfo/address: Station Road Near Central Bus Stand, Jaipur 302001 India

title: 見た目は悪くない
text:
このランクのホテルなら私は大丈夫なのですが…
ただただ寒い。１月のインド寒い。部屋で暖まりたいのに暖房がない…
バスタブがあったのでお湯をためて入るとバスタブが大理石風の石?で寒い。

暖まりたいのに寒い。だいたいこのランクのホテルならオケがあるのに。
オケがない。シャワーだけでは寒い。

ブルブル震えました。

寒さ対策して下さい。

インドのホテルの入室時はポーターさんがいる間に部屋の確認をした方が良いです。ときどきトイレットペーパーがなかったりするので備品の確認した方が良いです。
placeInfo/address: Station Road Near Central Bus Stand, Jaipur 302001 India

title: convenient location if you need a bus
text: Decent room, it was rainy and the sheets felt damp. a quick ride to the market area and the noise from the street was loud at night, bathroom was okay  but like all hotels i encountered it lacked hairdryers and toiletries and hot was was spotty.
placeInfo/address: Station Road Near Central Bus Stand, Jaipur 302001 India

title: I'd bring that special someone here
text:
We were three guys backpacking. We probably splashed out a bit here, because it isnt in a backpacker price range. It was nice staying in a smarter place for a change. Rooms were neat and clean, the bathroom was nice. 

One of the few places in India I didnt sleep in my sleeping bag, but slept in the hotel's bedding, and where I felt comfortable showering without flip-flops. 

The buffet breakfast was good. Always nice to have a solid meal before going out for the day. Theres an on-site bar and nice sitting areas in the foyer and outside at the back by the pool. 

It was December and cold, but I would have swam  in the pool, if it was warmer. The pool was so clean and tempting to dive in, but I guess it wasnt worth the pneumonia that would have followed.

The staff were friendly. The hotel is well located close to trains and buses. 

This doesnt seem like a big deal in other parts of the world, but in India, any establishment that accepts visa/mastercard is a plus in  my book, for the sheer convenience of it. And they dont charge extra because you paying by card (It is probably worked into the price I know, but it is nice that I didnt know that. Ignorance is bliss:) ) 

A thought that crossed my mind occasionally while visiting numerous budget hotels across India is, Would I stay here if I was travelling with that special someone? I would bring her here.
ownerResponse/text:
Dear Guest,

Greetings from Fort Chandragupt Hotel, tradition of Hospitality !

We are all delighted to know that you had a memorable stay with us. Our team has a strong focus on ensuring high standard of service delivery and I am so glad we were able to make your stay comfortable.

. We do hope you will have the opportunity to return to Jaipur soon and stay with us .
 
We have never and will never charge extra for card payments

Thanking you and assuring you of our best attention at all times,

Sincerely,
Abhijit Godara 
Owner

After complaining , they have arranged to clean the room , but still not good - CLEAN WITH A CLEAN CLOTH.
Bed & Tv - good.
Best part  - Food - Great.
Staff at the restaurant - ok ( very un - professionalService ).
Spa - Good (30% - discount ) presently.
No free wifi  - ( 1 hour / 200 ₹ ), speed i am not sure how much is it.

Overall 4* hotel with purely 3* ,but worth the stay (Single)for the price.

title: A decent budget hotel
text:
A decent budget hotel located very close to the bus stand. The first impression might not be good as it is located in an extremely noisy and crowded area with metro construction right in front of it. It is not a heritage property. Only the exteriors are designed like that.

Rooms were quite spacious with decent bathrooms. But a tip here is to avoid staying on the first floor of the property as it also houses a conference room. There was a lot of noise with loud music being played till 11:30 in the night. The hotel staff couldn't do much even after complaining. 

The buffet breakfast is also just fine. All in all, a budget hotel which one can go to only if they are not spending much time at the hotel!
placeInfo/address: Station Road Near Central Bus Stand, Jaipur 302001 India

title: good property with reasonable price
text:
it is reasonable priced hotel with best access to station busstand and market
hotel is quite big with ample parking space and considering if we want budget hotel it is a good place to be
sweet rooms are goods and bigger
food is average
placeInfo/address: Station Road Near Central Bus Stand, Jaipur 302001 India

title: Awful food, loud traffic
text: The hotel seemed a lot nicer than it actually is on arrival in the lobby, the money was clearly spent here and not in the rooms. The room was a good size and the bed was good to (compared to other Indian beds I stayed in). The TV didn't work and there was no wifi. The lunch when we arrived was terrible and overpriced so I didn't eat breakfast the following day. The hotel is located on a busy main road and Indian drivers beep non-stop throughout the night so poor sound proofing meant sleeping tablets and ear plugs were required. However, compared with some hotels I stayed at in India it wasn't too bad.
placeInfo/address: Station Road Near Central Bus Stand, Jaipur 302001 India

title: Muito bonito porém em local inseguro
text: Hotel muito bonito e muito bem decorado ao estilo indiano. A equipe é muito atenciosa e não tivemos qualquer problema com atendimento. Tivemos, porém, um pequeno probleminha pois o Wifi não funcionou durante nossa estadia. O wifi do hotel é pago (100 Rupias por hora). Apesar de não funcionar, nos deixaram usar o computador na sala da gerência pagando o mesmo preço que pagaria por Wifi. O Hotel tem uma bela piscina. Nosso guia nos informou que não era seguro sair do hotel para caminhar porque ficava em uma região perigosa para turistas. Isso foi um ponto muito negativo.
placeInfo/address: Station Road Near Central Bus Stand, Jaipur 302001 India

title: Könnte besser sein
text: Man kann in dem Hotel gut übernachten, besonders ist es aber nicht. Das Hotel ist in der Nähe gelegen. Etwas abgelegen, aber doch noch in laufentfernung, auch wenn man nicht die besten viertel quert. Bei der Ankunft hätte man gleich den Eindruck, dass man willkommen ist. Auch das zimmer machte if den ersten Blick einen guten Eindruck. Auf den zweiten Blick fällt leider auf, dass es sehr ungepflegt ist. Daher mit zwei Punkte.
placeInfo/address: Station Road Near Central Bus Stand, Jaipur 302001 India

title: Fort Chandragupta, Jaipur (NOT RECOMMENDED FOR FAMILY & EXTERNAL VISITORS)
text: I stayed there during 3-5 Oct 14. My experience was quite bad, which has many reasons. LOCATION is pathetic; you need to cross the whole city to reach at the hotel and situated in the congested locality and crowed place. ROOM SIZE is too small, we stayed in the suite, which is quite small and amenities provided were below standard. HOTEL STAFFS were unprofessional. This hotel completely lacks in its SERVICES, even Government guest houses are far better than this. Please don't go by the images provided on the website; it is way below than your expectations. It is a OVERPRICED accommodation. Seriously, NOT RECOMMENDED for family and external visitors.
placeInfo/address: Station Road Near Central Bus Stand, Jaipur 302001 India

title: Very Bad Service, do not stay here....
text: Property is nice looking, good looking reception area, but the service is pathetic. we book one sweet (room no. 221)and an executive room (218). we come here at 2 pm on 3 october 2014, but our rooms are not ready yet, after waiting for half hour we go to rooms. Both  rooms not cleaned properly. in Sweet room water is not coming from tap, TV is not working, refrigerator not working,and in Executive room only Hot water is coming from washbasin, charging points not working, Cable TV discontinue frequently, no tea-Coffey kettle in room,no tissue papers,no glass changed next day.no welcome drink. only payable WIFI. we have to adjust all this on day one. we left hotel at 5 pm for Choki dhani. at reception we tell them to arrange two extra bed in room before we come back. we promised to provide two extra bed in sweet for the children. we come back at around 11:30 and they does not arrange the beds. we call them for it. then the put two mattress on floor and say they only provide mattress as bed (what a commitment) but clearly we committed to provide two beds not mattress. we argue with Night manager. He ask his colleges about but could not provide bed. they give pour bed to another customers for more money.Night Manager only blame Day manager to overbook the hotel. we clearly tell them that we don't pay for the extra beds because they don't provide the beds. after several arguments manger provide us double mattress. we have to manage both nights. at the time of checkout minus 500 rs only n our bill. food is good.if you are from Delhi then you have to travel thru city jam to reach hotel. it is far from most  monuments and places.
placeInfo/address: Station Road Near Central Bus Stand, Jaipur 302001 India

title: You get what you pay for
text:
Don't judge this hotel by the surroundings because it is located in the older part of Jaipur bang on the station road and right next to the Bus Stop.
The location ensures that the shops around the hotel are open all night but it also means a lot a people and where there is crowd a lot of noise and a lot and a lot of litter follows. However the rooms have good sound proofing. The hotel is well maintained and clean.The restaurant and food were good with attentive staff. The rooms are spacious and relatively clean with decent bathroom. Hot water was always available. I had room facing the street but it was surprisingly quiet enough to sleep at night. The hotel is made like a Fort. The lobby and the common area are beautiful. They even have a small pool(it is very small). Overall a decent experience. I would say a good stay if you are on a budget. However pick a different place if you are looking for luxury and want to get away from the crowded streets. One downer was that the wifi service was paid :(
placeInfo/address: Station Road Near Central Bus Stand, Jaipur 302001 India

title: Well worth it
text:
Stayed as part of a tour, so can't comment on the prices. The hotel lobby is fabulous, the rooms nice and tidy and the beds comfortable. They do charge for wi-fi, which is a downer. Service was very good.

I started my Delhi-Belly experience here, just after we arrived. I had got the bug in Delhi that morning. The front desk arranged for a doctor to visit me; he arrived in under half an hour, and was a charming middle-aged gentleman with an excellent bedside manner. I was charged 1,200 (about $20US) and this included the meds and re-hydration packets. He even sent one of the hotel staff to bring the meds to me directly, so I only waited an additional 15 minutes and didn't have to venture out to find a pharmacy. He was obviously proud of his home city, so we had a nice chat about what I ought to do on my free time: I wasn't about to let the bug deprive me. I'm glad I didn't spend the time in my room, as the TV offerings were few and all in Hindi.

There's an ATM a couple meters to the left as you exit the front door. 

The hotel is in a good location, despite the construction going on in the street. Would book there again if going back.
placeInfo/address: Station Road Near Central Bus Stand, Jaipur 302001 India

title: Pretty good on the surface only
text: At first this hotel seemed fabulous - gorgeous Rajasthani lobby decor, flowers everywhere, garlands, welcome drinks, marble features, spacious rooms. Then we discovered our bathroom was being devoured by tiny cockroaches. They moved us to a room that wasn't nearly as great, and our shower curtain was covered in black mold, but that was nothing until I discovered my sheets hadn't been changed since the last guest, evidenced by stains and a considerable amount of shed hair. However, to their credit, they promptly changed the sheets and shower curtain, and breakfast and the laundry service were quite good.
placeInfo/address: Station Road Near Central Bus Stand, Jaipur 302001 India

title: overall good experience
text: Ambience wise hotel is very good...hotel provides small but a clean swiming pool. No changing room provided along with swiming facility...services are good but location is not good as it is situated in dense location...so much around hotel....
placeInfo/address: Station Road Near Central Bus Stand, Jaipur 302001 India

title: Overpriced, Dodgy pricing and short changing
text:
Stayed here 2 nights over New Year as part of a tour.  

First thing I noticed was that the prices were ridiculous.  Wifi was charged on a 24hr period whereas most places was free.  Laundry was expensive too but well done.  

Lots of confusion and chaos on the reception desk for a multiple of reasons. Seemed grumpy and unhelpful. 

The first room we were given was horrific, in a damp dark windowless part of the old hotel.  We changed for a much better double room overlooking the pool.  Rooms were small but warm!  A blessing in January.  

Not much bar action to be had in Jaipur so ended up paying the rather steep price for New Years Eve Gala dinner.  Was very good fun, mainly because there were lots of Indian families booked in, so got an authentic slice of Indian fun! 

Food in restaurant was average, and expensive.   Had a huge problem here with overcharging and incorrect change being given.  Prices kept changing, and I assume waiters pocketing the cash. As a group we complained about this.    

One of our group had someone come in the early morning walk into the room as it was unlocked and steal everything.  So lock your doors at night!! 

Location near the bus station, not too far from the old town.  Would suggest staying somewhere else as there seems to be lots of choice.
placeInfo/address: Station Road Near Central Bus Stand, Jaipur 302001 India

title: A great place to stay in Jaipur
text: It was a comfortable and reasonably priced hotel that provided decent rooms to relax in after coming in from the frantic streets and bazaars. The breakfast was pretty good. The staff wee also pretty helpful. I would recommend it.
placeInfo/address: Station Road Near Central Bus Stand, Jaipur 302001 India

title: Would stay here again
text: My husband and I stayed here for 2 nights as part of a G adventures tour. The hotel is located fairly close to the old city. It is bautifully decorated. We had a beautiful room overlooking the terrace/pool. The breakfast was good in the hotel restaurant. Internet was down while here. ATM conveniently located right out the front entrance doors. Not a lot of hot water here.
placeInfo/address: Station Road Near Central Bus Stand, Jaipur 302001 India

If They Focus More On The Food And Service This Can Be A Better Than Average Hotel. The Rooms Are Decent, Not Luxurious Though. Towels Are Old.

title: Disgusting treatment and worst behavior of the staff
text:
I arranged a stay at this hotel for my family from 19th Feb to 21st Feb. I thought it would be great as my mom and dad never had a luxury stay. I booked a royal room for them but the hotel staff and the manager especially treated them like sh**.
My experience is stated below:
1) I arrived early and opted for early check in from agoda, but the manager refused to accept it though that option was available.  First he said that rooms are fully booked but later after waiting for 3 hours he offered us to stay. Since we had nowhere to go, we chose to stay.
2) My parents asked them for water to drink so they said that they can offer either mineral water or RO water. But when my parents chose RO water which was free, they didn't provide us. Even after using their phone service they didn't pick up the phone. This happened like 5 to 6 times. 
3) The breakfast I paid for, was not worth at all. My parents had to ask or approach the pantry room after every order? The waiter didn't want to serve our table and he was only interested in serving others.  Trust me it felt like my parents were staying for free.
The only good thing about them is that the rooms are good. I don't know how their website claims to get a trip advisor award but seriously, I I'd have booked an OYO Executive than this.
I am leaving my contact in case if you want any additional input on this review. Cell :- 8879803890

title: Worst experience ever
text: This place and the management are pathetic. I had booked double deluxe room from 24Nov to 26 Nov 2021 2 nights stay. I booked through Agoda booking id- 588971625. I came to know on first night that instead of double bed they joined two single beds. I somehow managed to be there on first night and on next morning and I checked out and asked for refund for the 1 night since I stayed only for 1 night. They straightaway denied the refund. First of all they did not provide what was mentioned and then also denied the refund. Pathetic Hotel and Management. People please go with Pearl Palace Heritage it is an awesome hotel with awesome ambience and awesome rooms and in well budget. I stayed there for 2 nights. Rahul Jaiswal- 7977561109

Thanks for choosing during your recent visit to Jaipur and we appreciate your efforts for spending your valuable feedback on public platform. 
As per your concern would like to inform you that it is no where mentioned on Agoda or any other website that Deluxe room comes with only double bed  as we have  Deluxe room category in Double and Twin and that is why we have mentioned "Deluxe Room Double/ Twin. We have total 5 Rooms in this category out of which 3 are twin room and 2 are double. 
As per your special request only we have joined the beds for your comfort level.

title: A good hotel stay that could be better
text:
Overall a pleasant experience at Ramada Jaipur 
+ in general service was friendly, room was clean and mostly functional 
+ everything from housekeeping to restaurant staff to room quality was decent. Manoj at Around the World restaurant was very friendly and proactive - thanks for the thoughtful service. 

- it’s obvious the hotel has some age to it - furnishings are starting to be worn down, eg while most power sockets worked, and some didn’t, even the ones that worked looked like they might come out of the wall if you pull with more force. To be fair I can tell they replaced some parts of the room (the tv looks new) - but could be much better in terms of keeping up room condition. 
- service can be inconsistent - eg. sometimes restaurant staff is very proactive and checks on what you need quickly, sometimes they’re a bit lukewarm on the service; eg once I asked the front desk for something and they forgot about it / didn’t get back to me, but the next day I asked again and a different staff dealt with it immediately.
- beds are soft and I wonder if it’s due to age - something to note if you prefer harder mattresses - but I get it that some people prefer that.
placeInfo/address: Govind Marg Raja Park, Jaipur 302004 India

title: Unexpected "5 star" experience
text:
We landed in Jaipur on 14th August and decided to check-in to the hotel in the evening.
Upon reaching the hotel, I was quite surprised to note that there was no welcome drink offered to any of the guests, which is quite rare for a so-called "5 star hotel". 
Shout out to Sachin for being so lovely and carrying out the check-in process smoothly. 
The room was decent, but didn't give the luxurious aura one would expect from the Radisson group of hotels. 
Rom lighting was quite dim, which could pose a problem for those who appreciate well lit rooms. The bedsheets were quite old and stained. The room card kept getting deactivated, which was quite annoying, as we had to contact the front desk everytime we wanted to enter our room.
The breakfast spread was quite good, but the dining area wasn't big enough to accomodate the crowd. Tip: Go early to have a peaceful breakfast otherwise you'd have to wait.
Dinner was quite disappointing, the portion sizes and quality was unjustifiable for the exorbitant prices charged. The rice was undercooked and the dal lacked any flavour.
The pool was completely contradictory to the picture shown on Google images. Incredibly small and didn't have the privacy one would want to have a pleasant time with family. 
The staff who assisted us were helpful and were always at our beck and call. 
Overall it was a first and last time experience.
ownerResponse/text:
Dear Guest,

Thank you for your recent stay with us at Radisson Blu Jaipur.

We sincerely appreciate that you took the time to share the feedback on your recent stay with us. We are deeply sorry to hear about the feedback and we will definitely look into improving the issues you have raised. We apologise for the shortfalls.

Our team certainly looks forward to the opportunity to re-establish your trust in our standards of quality and have many more opportunities to serve you.

Warm Regards,
Hotel Management
Radisson Blu Jaipur

title: Great stay!
text:
Excellent Corporate Stay with Great Breakfast and Friendly Staff!
I had a truly pleasant corporate stay at this hotel during my business trip. The breakfast was delicious, with a good variety to choose from, and being included in the package was a definite plus for a busy work schedule. The staff were extremely friendly, professional, and always ready to assist with a smile, making my stay stress-free after long workdays. Their warm hospitality added a personal touch to the otherwise hectic corporate routine.

Point to Improve: Kindly ensure the swimming pool is kept clean at all times. During my stay, there were bird feathers and pigeons in the pool, which took away from the otherwise excellent experience.

title: Too Good Service by Staff Name Mr Akash
text:
Hotel Ramada is a great place to stay, whether you are traveling for work or on vacation. The rooms are clean, comfortable, and have everything you need like a TV, Wi-Fi, and good air conditioning. The beds are cozy, and the bathrooms are neat and well-maintained.

The staff at the hotel are friendly and helpful. They welcome you with a smile and try to make your stay as pleasant as possible. If you need anything, they are quick to respond.

The food at the hotel is also very good. There is a nice breakfast buffet with both Indian and international options. You can also order food to your room, and it usually arrives on time and hot.

The hotel has a gym, swimming pool, and spa for relaxation. These facilities are clean and well-kept. There are also conference rooms and banquet halls if you are there for business.

The location is another plus point. It is close to shops, restaurants, and other popular places in the city.

Overall, Hotel Ramada is a clean, safe, and comfortable hotel that offers good service and value for money. It’s a place where most guests will feel happy and relaxed.
placeInfo/address: Govind Marg Raja Park, Jaipur 302004 India

title: Avoid this hotel if you want a decent experience in Jaipur. You deserve better.
text:
Stay at your own risk!  If you want a pleasant stay and peaceful sleep, then just avoid this hotel!  Some problems at this hotel are as follows:

1. Staff seems untrained and rural. Lacks even basic communication skills.

2. Frequent power trips. Genset may be incapable of bearing AC loads.

3. The Shampoo, soap etc provided is cheap stuff. Better bring your own.

4. No Refrigerator provided in one of our rooms.  While no kettle provided in another room.

5. No regular housekeeping.  They will clean your room only when you leqve your key at reception and specifically ask them to clean your room.

6. Mattresses are cheap and wobbly.  Might give you a backache.

7. No parking available inside hotel.  You will have to park on road side.

8. Avoid their breakfast. long wait for items to arrive.  Average quality food.

9. If you are coming with you driver, then be aware that this hotel doesn't make any arrangements for drivers. Your driver will have to sleep in the car parked on the roadside.

What did we dislike as a family:

1. Extra beds not provided even after having beed booked and paid for in advance.

2.Lack of basic hygiene in hotel staff and inside restaurant.

2. Dirty swimming pool.

3. No adherence to Covid protocol.  Rooms not sanitizer. Sanitizers not offered to guests / visitors.  Several hotel staff wear their masks around their necks.

5. unskilled, rural Staff.

Overall, avoid this hotel if you want a decent experience in Jaipur. You deserve better.
placeInfo/address: D-194, Jagdish Marg, Banipark, Jaipur 302016 India

overall this is a superb choice in Jaipur - don’t bother with the older properties in the city, go and enjoy the tranquility of this Palace that is still very convenient to the main dual carriageway

title: Clean hotel + room + polite staff uncomfortable atmosphere.
text:
Clean, nice accomodation and hotel with accurate description online. 

Only 1 restaurant to eat at. The rooftop restaurant on the photos was not open and there was no evening entertainment. Breakfast adequate, cold breakfast (fair) hot breakfast (good), nice coffee machine. 
The lobby restaurant was clean and nice as seen in the photos, right next to reception.
Dinner, good choice on the menu with cheap/fair prices and good quality food prepared, with  polite waiters. Waiters extremely attentive at times a little to attentive with about five waiting around staring at you throughout the meal. They also are very quick on getting you to order waiting next to you which can feel a little pressurised at times. But very polite and attentive.

On arrival the reception staff were friendly polite and welcoming to the hotel. No complimentary flowers or drinks or special welcome on arrival, just normal check in. Only 2 small bottles of water given as complimentary.

The reception gave a choice of two rooms based on our favourite colours and let us view the rooms before we choose. The room was pretty, clean and tidy as shown on the pictures. Tea and coffee and kettle available in room. Bathroom was clean as shown on photos.  However if you want your room cleaned you need to give your only card to the reception in the morning for them to clean the room. The bedroom mattresses are highly uncomfortable.

The pool was not as pretty as the photos show, very small and outside next to the busy road. Only 2 lounge chairs for the entire hotel to share and 3 alternative tables. There was no food available to eat outside. There are many pool rules. Two of which state you have to wear a costume and swimming hat to use the pool. 

Unfortunately we attended during the Coronavirus scare and the hotel staff wore surgical masks and blue/white gloves for the remainder of our stay, which felt a bit uncomfortable. In the restaurant the staffs gloves were stained and dirty which made me uncomfortable with the level of cleanliness. They would be better not wearing gloves and washing their hands to be clean. The fact that they wore the surgical masks all day, made them void in working and the type they were wearing has been medical stated as not efficient in preventing the spread of the virus. To hear some staff cough under the masks, made me question the health of the staff of the hotel and the level of care they were taking to protect the guests from a chance of it spreading. So it made the stay a very different experience. However the staff once again we're very polite.

title: A good quality hotel with lovely decor throughout
text: We stayed here for two nights. We were impressed with the interior of the hotel. The rooms were lovely and the reception area very atmospheric with its curved seating areas set on each side of the main entrance hall. Unfortunately they are constructing the new metro right outside the front of the hotel, so it's not the prettiest of fron aspects, but this isn't the hotel's fault.  There is a large restaurant and the food looked good, although we didn't eat here. There is a large open-air swimming pool, but it was a bit cold for a dip when we were there in December.
placeInfo/address: Station Road Near Central Bus Stand, Jaipur 302001 India

title: Misleading but good
text: The pictures given here and on the hotel's website are a bit misleading. The hotel is not a 5star hotel and it doesn't really come close. However, it is still good. Better than most hotels. The hotel staff was very helpful and I was not charged anything extra. Had a bit of a problem and misunderstanding with the restaurant staff but they felt guilty and compensated for it. Overall, a good experience. I will recommend it to everyone, however expect a mid-range hotel, not a 5 star one.
placeInfo/address: Station Road Near Central Bus Stand, Jaipur 302001 India

title: Decoración bonita, servicio regular, restaurante un 10
text:
Estuvimos hospedados dos noches en el hotel, por el precio elegimos la Royal Suite, una pasada de habitación, decoración muy bonita, muy hindú pero algo antiguas las instalaciones.
El wifi para variar tampoco funcionaba.
El restaurante lo mejor de todo, muy buena atención por parte del responsable, siempre pendiente de nosotros y comida muy buena.
El personal de recepción parece algo perdido, sin saber muchas cosas del hotel ni de los servicios prestados, hemos pedido mapa y no tenian.
La hubicación del hotel buena aunque estaban en obras enfrente
placeInfo/address: Station Road Near Central Bus Stand, Jaipur 302001 India

title: Good Value For Money
text: The hotel was nicely made out, the rooms were spacious and had all the facilities. The hotel was clean and staff were very friendly. The hotel is a good hotel for its class and as such I was a bit of an Oasis after visiting the city and the service in some other hotels we had visited elsewhere in india.
placeInfo/address: Station Road Near Central Bus Stand, Jaipur 302001 India

title: Beautiful interiors, nice rooms and responsive room service....
text: We stayed here for 1 night, and it was a peaceful stay. Nice clean rooms, beautiful rajasthani interiors, clean pool and responsive staff. And on top of it, it was a budget. Nothing very expensive....
placeInfo/address: Station Road Near Central Bus Stand, Jaipur 302001 India

title: Decent Hotel, Staff Very Helpfull, Restaurant View and ambience is very good
text:
I have visited hotel 3-4 times. Located near to Central Bus station, still very calm as the main gate is not facing main road. The rooms are well maintained, though some rooms are less spacious. So ask for spacious room. The restaurant is well decorated. Food was very good. 
Best hotel near the Bus station and Rly station Area. Reception and staff response was good. I have seen lots of attitude in reception and staff at other hotels in same area. I recommend this hotel if you want to stay near Bus station or Rly Station.
placeInfo/address: Station Road Near Central Bus Stand, Jaipur 302001 India

title: nice food & services
text: it was my frst experience in jaipur.. i lyk the hotel most, they provide really good and hygienic food..location of the hotel is really good .. after entering in the hotel you will feel lyk a king ... room sevice really good.. bathrooms were clean and it provide both hot and cool water but please .. provide better mineral water .. overall fort chandragupt hotel is very good hotel.. :)
placeInfo/address: Station Road Near Central Bus Stand, Jaipur 302001 India

title: Nice Hotel & Food..!!
text: The Location of Hotel is very good. Rooms are clean and good and Room service is also excellent. Food quality is excellent with good variety . i am very happy with hotel and hotel staff. overall good experience. recommended...
placeInfo/address: Station Road Near Central Bus Stand, Jaipur 302001 India

title: Excellent Rooms
text: It was me second visit at this hotel, i like the location of the hotel. The premium rooms are very spacious with big windows. The lobby of hotel is very impressive, a small shopping arcade has very reasonabely priced exellent stuff. The food is very good, there is good varity at the breakfast buffet. overall a very good value for money hotel.
placeInfo/address: Station Road Near Central Bus Stand, Jaipur 302001 India

title: Great quiet rooms
text:
Jaipur is not a quiet place and the location of this hotel right by the bus station could be very noisy outside but in the rooms they have a noise proofing sorted. Our room overlooked the main street and the room was a peaceful haven. The bathrooms were a bit small but overall a good hotel. The reception area is particularly attractive. 

The internet wifi is charged for, which was a shame. 

At breakfast they were very keen to sell the breakfast which we had on the first day. It was nice and I liked the india elements more that the british. The eggs were freshly made to order.
placeInfo/address: Station Road Near Central Bus Stand, Jaipur 302001 India

title: Nice Hotel and Excellent SERVICE !!!
text:
I am overwhelmed with the hotel location and service.
Room is clean, though, we saw some dirt when we checked in. I reported the issue and they cleaned it in just 5 minutes.
Room service is excellent. They are quick to respond on what you need. 
Overall, I am very happy and consider this hotel for my next visits.
HIGHLY RECOMMENDED.
placeInfo/address: Station Road Near Central Bus Stand, Jaipur 302001 India

title: Jaipur - lovely trip
text: This place is a must visit for everybody travelling to Jaipur. Value for money. Good food... and am sure at the end of the trip - you will end up saying --- 'Wow... Mazaa aa gaya...!!! Infact the good part about the location of the hotel is that though the hotel is located in the heart of the city but once you enter the premises, you will end up getting all the peace and quietness.
placeInfo/address: Station Road Near Central Bus Stand, Jaipur 302001 India

title: dirty and noisy
text:
My room was very dirty, all sufaces had not been cleaned for ages. Breakfast buffet quite large but nothing very tasty there. Ordered some extra fruit but sent it back because it was mouldy.
Very noisy in the corridors and neighbouring rooms. Aircon inpossible to use, very loud.
Staff not very helpful and spoke poor English
placeInfo/address: Station Road Near Central Bus Stand, Jaipur 302001 India

title: Geen aangenaam hotel
text:
We zijn in dit hotel terecht gekomen door de de organisator van onze trip.
De eerste kamer die we kregen was een vuile, stinkende kamer met al het lawaai van buiten.
Er was een kleine douche geïnstalleerd en daarnaast een vuile wc gepropt!
Door tussenkomst van de toeroperator zijn we dan naar een andere kamer verhuisd.
Deze kamer was ok met een propere wc en bad.
We zouden dit hotel niet aanraden aan anderen!
placeInfo/address: Station Road Near Central Bus Stand, Jaipur 302001 India

title: Real nice place
text: This place is a treat to live in ...at a real economy cost..the rooms are big..well furnished..the buffet breakfast was nice...service was warm. the location is right next to the bus stop n near the station.
placeInfo/address: Station Road Near Central Bus Stand, Jaipur 302001 India

title: Pretty Nice..
text:
We Stayed here for part of a tour of India we did in November 2012. It was our second hotel experience in India and we were pretty happy with the hotel. One Arrival we were greeted with drinks, flowers necklaces and a blessing. I thought that was a very nice touch. 
Our room was spacious and had lots of light. I did find it difficult to find the correct light switch in the room because there are about 10 different light switches scattered around the room. 

The Bathroom was nice with a large tub and nice HOT water. Just let the hot water run for a few minutes and once it gets hot its Plentiful! However it can take a while to get hot in your room since the boilers are far way. 
The Room was clean and bug free.
The buffet on the 2nd floor was very nice! Good food and good service. Most dishes are not too spicy, however my suggestion to management would be to PLEASE label the Indian spicy dishes with a scale of how hot. One night I got a dish that with one bite I thought I was going to have to cut my tongue out it was so hot. Overall I enjoyed the food here very much. If you have the Breakfast then try the Indian Breakfast here because its good. 
Good place to stay in Jaipur.. easy for Tuk Tuk drivers to find . Just tell them beside the bus station that seemed to work for us.
placeInfo/address: Station Road Near Central Bus Stand, Jaipur 302001 India

title: Good and Bad Hotel
text: On arrival, this hotel seemed very fancy with a swimming pool and a spa. It is also located near the bus station so there are plenty of conveniences around such as bank machines, food vendors and transportation options. The location also seems decent although I was confused walking through the gates so it wasn't terribly far but also wasn't right by your doorstep. On to the negatives, all the electrical plugs seem quite questionnable so it takes some trial and error throughout the room to charge your devices. The spa was incredibly expensive especially since the services were somewhat shady and dirty. I definitely would stay away from their "spa".
placeInfo/address: Station Road Near Central Bus Stand, Jaipur 302001 India

title: En oase i (by)ørkenen
text: Vi rakk ikke bussen og måtte finne oss et sted å sove. Fort Chandragupt, som ligger like ved busstasjonen, viste seg å være en suksss. Hotellet er en oase i den kaotiske byen Jaipur er. Betjeningen er svært vennlige og rommene på dette flotte hotellet holder 1. klasse standard. En meget positiv overraskelse, like ved en busstasjon forventer ¨man ikke å finne slik luksus. (La deg ikke lure av inngangen ut mot gaten, den egentlige inngangen ligger på baksiden, da oppdager du hvilket palass du egentlig bor i)
placeInfo/address: Station Road Near Central Bus Stand, Jaipur 302001 India

title: Nice hotel in Jaipur
text: The Hotel is in a good location on a main street, and is surprisingly nice inside.  It's got great facilities and the rooms are large and clean, with comfortable beds.  From the outside it doesn't look like much but inside it is great value for money.
placeInfo/address: Station Road Near Central Bus Stand, Jaipur 302001 India

title: awsome journey
text: ita really nice to be at this hotel..initially was reluctant but ambience and service was really awsome..highly recommended. the staff was helpful. a real value for money i would say. they take care of you...thanks a lot cleartrip
placeInfo/address: Station Road Near Central Bus Stand, Jaipur 302001 India

The food was awesome. The poolside area is good. Overall very nice royal stay. Keep it up. I recommend for Laxmi Palace Heritage Boutique Hotel.

Best Of Luck!
 
AGRA TAJ TOUR
NEW DELHI

title: bof!
text:
Catalogue comme 4 étoiles, il n'en mérite, selon les standards occidentaux, que 3 et n'a d’héritage et de palace que le nom.

Globalement l’hôtel est propre.  Mais  si  tout le nécessaire était présent [aucun problème d'eau chaude ou même de pression d'eau pour la douche],  notre chambre était petite et la literie inconfortable; en outre, la salle a manger tient plus de la cantine et la nourriture proposée lors du buffet le soir était tellement epicee [pour notre palais!] que nous avons du compléter le repas par des biscuits que nous avions dans notre valise..
Localise en retrait de la grand route, il y a peu de bruits extérieurs [même avec la fenêtre ouverte]; par contre, le frigo fait un bruit de fond vraiment gênant.

bref, je ne le recommande pas

title: NOT FOREIGNERS FRIENDLY HOTEL
text:
We booked this hotel online two weeks before our trip to Jaipur.
They have projected beautifully online. Pictures looked good online. We had spent hours for booking a nice hotel online. After seeing good pictures we booked with our credit card.
But Boy when we arrived at the reception! Our bad day started! Receptionist told us the hidden prices and spoke harsh! Online it showed 2500/- and at reception we were told 5,500/- since we were three, they charged us 1500/- for express person to stay in the same room. We paid 7000/- for a room per night. We stayed here anyway for four nights, because that’s what we had booked online with our credit cards. 
We had booked Royal rooms online, and after entering the rooms, there were nothing Royal about the room, I should have sued this hotel for false advertising. Bathrooms were leaking, bad furnishing, the electricity would go off anytime.
and on the check out, the receptionist asked us to write good review! 
HECK NO! I’d give 0 star!
ownerResponse/text:
Dear Guest, 
Thanks for considering and staying with us during your recent visit to Jaipur. We also appreciate your effort towards sharing your feedback on public platform which is always beneficial for other guest to find their stay. 

As far as your issues are concerned would like to clear that online you'll get different deal wherein hotel booking website are giving huge discounts to customers from their own pocket whereas sometimes rates are different due to browser history, cookies and caches but that doesn't mean we are charging higher rates for foreigner or Indian. From hotel point of view every one is same. 

We look forward to serve you in near future. 
Warm Regards, 
Bhanu Pratap Singh 
General Manager

title: Average stay; checked out a day early
text:
We booked in for a 3 night stay, but ended up staying just for 2. We went in as a family of 4 and there was enough bedding for all of us, but the place was cramped for space and it felt a bit claustrophobic.

The location wasn’t great, as our driver had difficulty finding the place and we never ventured out on foot. Plenty of road noise crept into the room at night and we found it difficult to sleep.

Food was also average and the kids found it too spicy. The free breakfast buffet spread was just passable. 

No door in the shower meant that the water splashed all over the bathroom floor making it completely wet - not a great feeling having wet floor!

The fridge didn’t work, and the staff advised me that all it does is keep it at room temperature (!) without bothering to look it up. Turns out, it was sharing the same plug as the kettle and the previous guest must have swapped it (it was left for me to figure it out)

I lost one day’s payment as we left a day early, but was a good decision in my mind. If you are on a budget, this place may work for you...but I fell for the “heritage” tag and expected a different experience.

title: Very pleasant stay
text: Our vehicle driver took us to the backside of the hotel and we found it not worthy while entering. But to our surprise, the hotel is like a fort only. The interior and exterior are too good and the rooms are very luxury. The locality is very good. The room service is excellent. The restaurant is good and the interior is excellent. The people working at reception are very helpful and they gave us one room even after we vacated our rooms for fresh-up. Totally excellent experience and highly recommending for others also.
placeInfo/address: Station Road Near Central Bus Stand, Jaipur 302001 India

title: Surprisingly luxurious and very pleasant stay
text: Like other reviewers, we were with with a Gap Adventure tour. This is a reliable company that always does its homework before placing it clients in hotels. The hotel was a very unexpected surprise, quite luxurious with beautiful rooms, excellent service, a good restaurant and a swimming pool. The location is very good. You'd be quite happy staying here
placeInfo/address: Station Road Near Central Bus Stand, Jaipur 302001 India

title: Great Stay
text: We stayed there on our G Adventures tour and were amazed at the quality of the rooms the hotels swimming pool  was a great place to relax and we found all staff at the hotel very welcoming the hotel just had a great vibe about it
placeInfo/address: Station Road Near Central Bus Stand, Jaipur 302001 India

title: Really overpriced, horrific service
text:
We stayed here for three nights in February - 2 rooms for 4 people.  The rooms were a bit shabby, we had nails sticking out of our bed head and the fridge was really filfthy and didn't work.  The TV also did not work properly.  The first night we were woken by shouting and yelling in our hallway and also right outside our window.  This was about 5am.  We then heard our phone ring, only to answer it have them hang up in our ear.  I rung the reception and said there was a fire in the adjacent hotel's kitchen and we were to evacuate.  Our friends in the room beside us got no call.  We quickly dressed and took our valuables down to the lobby where there were a few other guests.  Staff were no where to be seen and we eventually went back to our room when we found out it wasn't our hotel.

The next morning - wake up call at 5.25am, same thing - answers but hangs up. This also happens in our friends' room.  I spoke to the Manager later that morning and I doubt he understood me as he just stared blankly.

Third morning, AGAIN!  I dressed this time and walked down to the reception where again I got nothing but blank stares.

Really unimpressed with this hotel - it makes out it is something it isn't.  The staff here were just not inetrested in us at all.
placeInfo/address: Station Road Near Central Bus Stand, Jaipur 302001 India

title: Good experience
text: We were there at hotel Fort Chandragupt for a business meeting. It was a nice experience. I like the hospitality and food there. Very good place to stay. the behavior of staff members and specially Mr. Surendra-manager was very helpful. Feeling like home there.
placeInfo/address: Station Road Near Central Bus Stand, Jaipur 302001 India

title: Excellent

title: Fort Chandragupt
text:
I had more good and less  bad experiences staying in the hotel. it is located next to the siddhi camp(main bus terminus) from airport you can take a pre paid taxi they charged around 320 rs. my heart missed some beats when I first saw this hotel entrance. it was located in a very crowded place and I realized the reason was there was a metro rail construction going on near by. there have a well maintained room with very clean bathroom toilets. Though the hotel looks little old. I suggest this for people travelling with family. The hotel is located very near to all the jaipur attraction.
auto fare I paid
M.I road  - 40 rs
zouhri bazaar - 50 rs.
City palace - 50 rs.  
    the restaurant Maurya was also. they provided compliment breakfast. For budger travellers who feel the restaurant was costly. there is a restaurant apposite to this hotel other side of the road you can get the food packed. The room service was good and on time but the people where little unfriendly.
placeInfo/address: Station Road Near Central Bus Stand, Jaipur 302001 India

title: Excelled Hotel
text:
Fort Chandragupt is one of the best Deal to stay in Jaipur. The have well appointed Room and attached Bathroom. Excellent Room service. Breakfast was great and a very lavish included Indian, Continental. Variety for Lunch and Dinner.

Well equipped Bar. In house Travel desk

Friendly Staff
placeInfo/address: Station Road Near Central Bus Stand, Jaipur 302001 India

title: Nicht empfehlenswert
text:
Das Hotel liegt an einer vielbefahrenen Straße ziemlich weit von Herzen von Jaipur entfernt. Die Zimmer nach hinten hinaus zum Pool waren recht ruhig und hatten eine gute Größe und verfügen über einen Kühlschrank und Klimaanlage, Das Bad war sauber, doch leider gab es während unseres Aufenhalt kein heißes Wasser. Sehr ekelig- im Bett lag noch die Unterwäsche des Vormieters. 
Der Frühstücksraum und anscheinend auch die Küche wurden während unseres Aufenthaltes umgebaut, dementsprechend frugal fiel das Frühstücksangebot aus - Toast, Tee, Eier und Bananen - auf schmuddeligen Tellern im Zimmer serviert. Man kann für weniger Geld deutlich besser wohnen.
placeInfo/address: Station Road Near Central Bus Stand, Jaipur 302001 India

title: Vreselijk vies en gehorig hotel.
text:
Wij waren hier in oktober en hebben het als een zeer onplezierig hotel ervaren.
De vloer van onze kamer was ontzettend smerig (ook nadat men hem nogmaals had schoongemaakt). In het restaurant lagen de rijstkorrels van de vorige avond nog bij het ontbijt. De toiletruimtes bij het restaurant waren zeer vies en roken zeer onaangenaam. De wekdienst belde ons te pas en te onpas wakker, kortom
GEEN aanrader!

text:

title: LUSSO A JAIPUR
text:
Di gran lunga il migliore dei nostri alloggi durante il tour indiano.
L'hotel è di alto livello, le camere sono molto belle, accessoriate ed eleganti e la terrazza sul tetto offre un ottimo ristorante.
La colazione è molto varia e ha anche delle opzioni più vicine ai nostri gusti occidentali.
Lo staff sempre cortese e disponibile e assolutamente non insistente dal punto di vista mance.
Abbiamo utilizzato anche la piscina che è piccola ma piacevole per rinfrescarsi dalle torride giornate indiane!
insomma... assolutamente consigliato!

La zona non è molto centrale, ma nonostante ciò noi siamo riusciti a raggiungere il centro di Jaipur con una bella e polverosa camminata

title: Cheap but not so cheerful - 2night stay (3rd stop) on our India trip
text:
Firstly, if were were rating the roof top restaurant is would be 5 stars for the quality of the food and service, together with the entertainment if you arrive at 7.30. 

However, the hotel is in need of some investment. The air con unit in our first room sounded like a tractor so it wasn’t useable during the night. To their credit the hotel staff were happy to move us the next day to a room that felt more modern, particularly in terms of the A/C. Unfortunately, that room had no hot water so we had to shower in yet another room. Perhaps we were just unlucky!

title: Excellent Stay!
text: Laxmi Palace Heritage and Boutique Hotel is located centrally near the Railway Junction and Bus Stop.  It is a residential hotel with spacious and comfortable rooms. title: Súper Hotel en Jaipur
text:
Traslado del aeropuerto al hotel gratuito  (Sandeep el conductor). Llegué tarde y se preocuparon de instalarme rápido en la habitación. Impresionado por el hotel  con todo lujo de detalles. Destacaría ubicación (tranquila a 1 min del ambiente de la ciudad), restaurante (buen precio, comida de calidad en comparación con lo que encuentras en la calle), habitación espaciosa y atención del personal.

Hice un tour con Sandeep (taxi driver) y fue genial. Sabe inglés, te cuenta historias y hasta se ofrece para sacarte fotos. 

El último día antes de partir tuvieron el detalle de ofrecerme un chai tea de cortesía mientras esperaba la hora de partida del tren.

Tenéis que ir!

Nous devions prendre un train le lendemain qui finalement a été annulé, nous avons demandé conseil au personnel qui nous a orienté vers une station de bus non loin. J’y retournerai les yeux fermés. title: La peggior esperienza della mia vita
text:
Tralasciando la descrizione della stanza vado dritta al punto e riporto di seguito la mia esperienza perché possa essere da monito per altri viaggiatori.
Ho alloggiato presso la struttura per due notti con il mio fidanzato e una coppia di amici.
Al momento del check out, mentre io saldavo il conto alla reception, il mio ragazzo riscontrava un blocco alla cassaforte in camera dove aveva riposto 1200 euro il giorno prima.
Ha quindi chiamato l’assistenza per aprire la cassetta.. tuttavia all’interno non c’erano più 1200 euro ma 900.. 300 euro erano spariti!! 
Abbiamo denunciato subito l’accaduto al manager che, dopo aver brevemente interrogato il personale di servizio, ci ha detto che non poteva farci nulla.
Siamo, quindi, andati alla polizia e li siamo stati raggiunti dal manager e dai (presunti) proprietari che ci hanno proposto di ridarci tutti i soldi mancanti.
Siamo, dunque, tornati presso la struttura per riavere i nostri soldi.. dopo una scena pietosa i (presunti) proprietari hanno convinto il mio ragazzo a firmare delle carte e gli hanno dato metà dei soldi rubati.
Io non ho firmato nulla (e metà di quei soldi erano i miei) mi sento, pertanto, libera di denunciare in questa sede l’accaduto affinché altri viaggiatori non facciano il nostro stesso errore di confidare nella sicurezza delle cassette e soprattutto della struttura.

Da ultimo segnalo che la struttura, dopo l’accaduto, ha scritto a Booking che non ci eravamo mai presentati (nulla di più falso!!) in modo tale che non potessi fare la mia recensione su quella piattaforma. Ennesima conferma di mala fede. 
Io personalmente consiglio di diffidare.

Ich ziehe einen Stern ab, weil erstens abends immer mal der Alarm losging, scheinbar ohne Grund. Zudem sind die Zimmer vom Flur her recht hellhörig. Es waren einige laute Italiener dort...
Den Pool konnte ich nicht nutzen, da dort abends immer live Puppentheater aufgeführt wurde. Wenn man dort hin ging wurde man quasi genötigt zuzusehen und dann später etwas zu bezahlen.

title: Encantados con este hotel
text:
Nos alojamos en este hotel tres noches, fue una experiencia muy agradable.

El desayuno es de tipo buffet y había como 8 platos calientes diferentes, te chai, café, cereales, etc

Tiene piscina en la planta baja y te proporcionan toallas.

Los platos que pedimos en el restaurante estaban bien de sabor.

El personal tanto de recepción, como de restaurante, es muy agradable.

La habitación como se puede ver en las fotos, estaba decorada con dibujos en las paredes similares a copos de nieve, muy bonitos. El baño estaba muy bien, grifería en muy buen estado y ducha separada del resto, aunque en mi opinión para ser perfecto le faltaría una mampara para evitar salpicar fuera.

La cama era muy cómoda y la ropa de cama estaba muy limpia.

En general el hotel tiene unos altos niveles de limpieza, un día al llegar había tres trabajadores limpiando el techo del pasillo, si se preocupan por el techo imaginad lo que limpiarán.

Si volviera a Jaipur me alojaría aquí sin dudarlo un momento.

Merece la pena alojarse en este hotel y poder desconectar del caos de Jaipur. 
Las habitaciones están muy bien insonorizadas y es un lujo no escuchar ni un solo ruido.

title: Lovely hotel
text: We stayed in this hotel for the first 2 nights of our tour of Rajasthan over the Easter break. It was a good choice. We had booked 2 rooms - one got upgraded & unfortunately the other downgraded. However, following a conversation with the reception staff the downgrade was upgraded despite us arriving at 11pm at night & there being limited staff available to prepare the new room. Unfortunately the restaurant was not open even for room service but we were able to get a takeaway delivered & the hotel staff gave us crockery & cutlery without prompting. All a bit manic for a first night but the hotel staff did all they could to help & makae us comfortable. Overall the stay was good & a nice start to our tour.

title: Superb Stay
text: Having stayed in many hotels in India this past month, we have learnt to expect the worse, because most hotels look nothing like the glamorous photos. But this place does! Believe me! The hotel is finished to a high standard, with lovely decor. It's really clean and spacious. The bed is super comfortable, best in India. The pool is great. The staff are so friendly and always helpful. It's a bit back off the main road, so it's quieter, but that also means it's a few kms walk to the local sights. That was ok for us, we like walking, but some people might think it's too far. Plenty of tuktuks around to take you anywhere. Our only negative point is that we didn't get our welcome drink that was on our booking confirmation 😔 Overall, great value hotel, would definitely recommend.

title: Sehr schönes Hotel und gutes Restaurant
text:
Sehr freundlich und höflich werden wir an der Rezeption empfangen. Der Check- In ist kurz und unkompliziert. Als der Page uns das Zimmer 209 öffnet treten wir in ein perfektes Hotelzimmer. Groß, sehr nett eingerichtet, großes Bad mit super Dusche und vielen Kleinigkeiten. Hausschuhe, Zahnbürsten und sogar die Trinkgläser sind verpackt und man fühlt sich direkt wohl.
Im Restaurant sind die Tische eingedeckt und ein eleganter Restaurant Chef empfängt uns. Nach einem tollen und leckeren Abendessen, einer guten Nacht ohne Rückenschmerzen vom Bett, starten wir nach dem guten Frühstück in das Leben von Jaipur. Das Hotel ist aufjedenfall zu empfehlen mit den aufmerksamen und netten Hotel Angestellten. Gruß von Christian und Diana aus Deutschland.

title: Beware of the Laxmi Palace Heritage Boutique Hotel!
text:
BEWARE OF THIS HOTEL!! 
I am currently staying in this hotel, the Laxmi Palace Heritage Boutique Hotel, in Jaipur, Rajasthan, India. I ordered room service, and there was a mistake in my food order, so I requested one of the items be returned. The hotel staff member initially agreed, but then refused, and insisted I sign for the bill, including the item that was supposed to be returned. I had to call the front desk to speak to the hotel manager, to inform management of what happened, and they quickly rectified the situation, taking the food item away, and also taking it off my food bill. 
Now I feel as if the hotel staff is taking retribution on me. I am quite sick, as I ate something here in India that did not agree with my stomach, and my room has run out of toilet paper. I asked a staff member, and they agreed to bring me toilet paper, but after 45 minutes of waiting, no one ever came. (As a reference, during the first two evenings I was here, requests were consistently accommodated within 1-4 minutes, incredibly quickly.) I then contacted the front desk again, to speak to management, once again, and they apologized profusely and said they would have someone bring toilet paper to my room “immediately”. That was over an hour ago. I’m quite positive, given the extreme attention to detail and quick service during my first 2 nights here, that what is happening at the moment, is that the hotel management is directing their staff to carry out instructions for servicing my room, but the staff has essentially gone “on strike” concerning the needs of my room. This is one of the most incredibly, maliciously obnoxious and unprofessional treatments I have ever observed at any hotel, across 45 countries and five continents. I am not only inclined to never again stay at the Laxmi Hotel, but I would advise travelers to avoid this mismanaged hotel at all costs. It is a shame, because my India experience has been stellar thus far, up until this unfortunate event. I won’t be taking it out on India, rather, simply this hotel. Beware the Laxmi Palace Heritage Boutique Hotel.

title: Lovely hotel in quiet residential area. Spacious, clean & comfortable rooms. FAB shower
text:
I liked the: 
1) Housekeeping - really efficient and hard-working. Despite construction, the rooms and bathrooms were spotless. Laundry was done time with good quality. 
2) Rooms - FAMILY room had 2 full baths, a sitting room with 2 diwans, and a king-size bed. Very comfortable for family of 4 or 5. And DELUXE room had 1 full bath and a king size bed. Both rooms came with good closet space. 
3) The shower was phenomenal - super hot water and very strong pressure. Everyone enjoyed their end-of-day showers after roaming around Jaipur 

Cons (Dec 2018)
There was construction during our stay meant loud grinding noise and dust on the ground (reception) floor. The manager assured us that this would finish soon and would result in a spa and pool. Welcome amenities. 

Location - fairly close to the train station, and about 20min away from City Palace/Jantar Mandar/Hawa Mahal. 

Tips - UBER works really well, and I'd recommend it over the tuk-tuks which charge any amount they feel like.

title: Great Service, Clean Hotel !
text:
Easy check-in. Rooms seemed new, clean, all sparkling marble. Entire hotel has beautiful ethnic decor, and yet doesn't have a run-down look and feel that you can get in a "heritage" hotel. 
Mohd. Arbaaz, the front desk manager was very professional and flexible. There is some construction going on in a separate portion of the hotel, but guests are isolated from that area, so no bother. The only reason we are giving 1 star less is because the room shower area didn't have enough cover, so the water would spill just a little bit on the floor. That's not too much of an inconvenience, though. 
Did I mention the awesome breakfast which was included in our package ?
Overall, the hospitality was great.

title: Best hotel of our stay
text:
We spent two weeks travelling India and visited 5 cities. Without doubt, our stay at Laxmi palace was our favourite and most comfortable. 

With tasteful design throughout, extremely helpful staff and a central location, this hotel really delivered great value for money and left us hoping that each of our next stays during our trip was as good an experience as this one (they weren't).

Some construction is still going on to extend and improve the hotel, however this didn't impact us at all. I'm sure the hotel will be even better once all is complete.

Thoroughly recommend.

title: Not worthy
text: This hotel looks like a home from the outside and the interiors feel the same too. But this place has nothing good to offer except a normal stay. I went here for a weekend with my friend and wasn't satisfied. They didn't help us with a flexible check-in and had to wait in the lobby for a few hours. Later was charged extra for wanting to check-in early. Just the fact that I loved the food here, though we just had a dinner here, as we both were extremely tired after roaming about the city the whole day. But if you are in Jaipur, please try the local cuisine in the local shops, they are lovely. Anyway, this hotel is not as good as it seems.

title: Terrible -- Avoid Laxmi Palace
text: Do not be fooled. Laxmi Palace is a one star hotel, likely some of the better reviews are because people are confusing it with a similarly-named (better) hotel. The room we were given was dirty and damp, and everything seemed old and tired. It was bad enough that we paid to move and go elsewhere (eating the room cost), and actually another couple who arrived separately (and were equally unimpressed) did the same (which should give you a sense -- that is n a ne night). I hate to be harsh, but It really did not feel like their heart is in it. For a $1,000 rupee budget option it could be ok (but for the prices they are listing at on booking sites it is ridiculously over-priced, and the pictures make it look way better than it is). Avoid IMO.
